Anna has been a teacher since 1990. She teaches at a local school and also provides additional lessons at home. Anna lives with her grown-up children, and her husband works abroad and tries to support his family financially. 

Currently, the income that Anna gets from her business is very important for the whole family. Unfortunately, there are no facilities in her house for providing classes to her students, so Anna has applied to SEF for the help. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Anna to purchase tables, chairs and notebooks and will make her work with students comfortable and effective. Anna hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tables and chairs and notebooks.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has no children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a food-selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en: Eva, who is in her early 40's, is married with two children, a boy and a girl, who are in school. Eva has been selling beans and rice for seven years. She works from 8 AM to 6 PM every working day and is able to make a very good return. This is her seventh loan request of GHS 1,000 from ID-Ghana which she will use to buy a two big bags of rice and beans which she will sell to customers. All of her previous loans were repaid successfully. Eva used her business profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to build her own house. She is collecting this loan with four others. Caroline sells slippers, Theodora sells gari (processed cassava), Salomey sells provisions, and Abena sells second hand clothing. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan amount of GHS 5,900.

loans.use: to buy two big bags of rice and beans which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Dolores Maria

texts.es: Doña Dolores es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora  vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo quien actualmente estudia, hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de accesorios decorativos (bisutería) como: collares, aritos, pulseras, llaveros, etc.  con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Dolores solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales hilos, perlas de colores, diferentes tipos de piedras, cristales, colgantes, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores is a very responsible and hard-working person.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her son, who is currently in school.  For several years she has been making and selling decorative accessories (costume jewelry) like necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and key chains, etc.  With what she gets from her business she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Dolores is requesting a loan to buy materials like thread, different colors of pearls, different types of stones, crystals, and pendants, etc.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her work.  This way she will get better income with which she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, different colors of pearls, different types of stones, crystals, and pendants, etc.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is a 34-year-old married lady who has been working from her house for eighteen years preparing and selling handmade crafts and special occasion souvenirs for her living. She loves her business a lot and works hard to develop it by releasing new items and themes where she works to attract the customers' attention so that they will request more.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business tools and necessary souvenir needs and be able to use new released themes and designs. She hopes that one day she will be capable of affording to open her own handmade souvenir shop that will attract more customers and develop her business widely.

loans.use: to increase her business tools and necessary souvenir needs and be able to use new released themes and designs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, concentrated feed, and supplies for their growth.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Maria de 63 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposa, hace varios años se dedica a su tienda, posee mucha clientela por  la variedad de productos que tiene, la amabilidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como: papel higiénico, granos básicos, huevos, aceite, refrescos, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 63, is a very responsible and hard-working person.  She lives in her own house with her husband.  For several years she has had a store.  She has a lot of clientele because of the variety of products that she has, her friendliness, and the good prices.  With what she gets from her business she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like toilet paper, basic grains, eggs, cooking oil, and soft drinks, etc.  With this she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, basic grains, eggs, cooking oil, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Santos Ceferino

texts.es: Don Santos es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive solo en casa propia, hace varios años  se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y adicional a esto trabaja de albañil, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Santos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así seguir con sus cosechas y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Santos is a very responsible and hardworking person. He lives alone in his own house. For several years, he has worked in agriculture, planting corn and beans. In addition, he works as a builder. With his earnings from his work, he is able to meet some of his household expenses. Santos is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc. This way he will continue with his harvests and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis has been involved in this stone workshop for five years. He is a stone abrasive worker and is already very skilled in that sphere. Sargis lives with his parents, wife, and two little children. He works hard to sustain his family's living and provide them appropriate living conditions.

Now this hardworking and honest man needs financial support.  With this loan's help, Sargis will be able to purchase tools and equipment for his stone workshop and gather more income. As the current machines in the workshop are already very old and needs to be replaced with new ones, this loan will greatly assist Sargis. He hopes for lenders' support.

Sargis has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for  stone workshop

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a food selling business, making beans, and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en: Narcisse is 24 years old. He owns a boutique and has been running the business for the past two years. He wants to buy more soda, beer, sugar, and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house in the future after the savings have been accumulated.

loans.use: to buy more soda, beer, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Theobard

texts.en: Theobard is 32 years old. He is married with two children. The loan will be used to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a bar for a better future of the business. He has a dream to become a distributor in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a hard working woman who struggles to meet the demands of her family. She appreciates your previous loan that helped her to boost the income of her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 60,000 to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar for sale. She appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi operates a food selling business. She sells in a grocery from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en: Besik is a 27-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in the capital city of Georgia. Besik and his wife are unemployed now. His relatives help them with money. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. So, he decided to start a taxi business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Besik received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $1200, he will pay a toll for his car, which he has purchased already. He will serve local people as a taxi driver and generate income.

loans.use: to pay a toll for his car

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en:
Hannington is a repeat client at the branch who has applied for a loan of ugx 1,000,000. He lives in a rural area in Kyabugashe Nyakagyeme – Rukungiri with his family of four children and a wife. He is majorly involved in agriculture. He grows coffee and bananas which he has done for many years to earn a living. He also rears goats and pigs as his additional income. He has managed to raise his income to meet his family needs, and pay school fees for his children and some orphans left behind by his late brothers.

His dream is to buy more land to increase his agricultural activities, and to buy a pick-up to transport his products to market and also fetch manure to fertilize his land.

His main challenge is lack of capital to meet his customers demands, especially piglets and kids (baby goats) that he will breed and later sell. Therefore he wants this loan to address that challenge.

Despite the above mentioned challenges, Hannington is a hardworking man and determined to change his future through proper agricultural practices.
In the photo is Hannington with his wife.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and goats to breed and later sell

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una panadería en su lugar de habitación, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad a la hora de vender, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad que le ha dejado muchas ganancias que le han servido para cubrir algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en  el hogar , doña María está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de latas, levadura, harina, azúcar, etc. para la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder seguir obteniendo buenas ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su hijo.
texts.en: Maria, 57, lives in her own house with her son. She has a bakery in her home. She has a lot of customers because she is friendly when she is selling. She has been doing this work for several years, which has given her a lot of profits. This has helped her to cover some of the expenses that come up at home. Maria is asking for a loan to buy cans, yeast, flour, sugar, and more to make the food, and this way be able to keep earning good profits to have greater economic stability with her son.

loans.use: to buy cans, yeast, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Veredianne

texts.en: Verediane is 49 years old. She sells shoes and clothes. She has spent ten years in the business. She wants the loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a thirty five year old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal,Uganda. She sells tomatoes in order to earn a living but also earns a salary as a civil servant. The fact that tomatoes are highly perishable and a lack of efficient preservation equipment pose a challenge to her business growth, while her dream is to venture into commercialized tomato growing. She wishes to educate her children up to the University. Sarah intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is from Kapan town where he lives with his parents. He has been involved in retail business for many years. Particularly, Robert sells clothing from his home to locals and gathers income. This source of income is the only for the family, so it is very important for Robert to sell more clothing and be able to cover his family's costs. 

Now Robert asks a loan for purchasing new stock of clothing for selling it to customers. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Robert to increase the stock of clothing and meet his clients' demand.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing for selling it to customers

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients where perishable goods can lead to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Egidienne

texts.en: Egidienne is 31 years old. She is married with five children. With the loan, she would like to buy more peanuts and flour for sale. She expects to use the profits for saving to get a driving permit for her husband.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a constructor with 9 years of experience. He is making different types of sculptures, gravestones from stones and other materials and he sells them to locals. Due to the high quality of his work, Artur has many customers who value his professionalism and the beauty of his sculptures.
 
Artur is making Armenian "khachqars" well-known; "khachqars" are highly demanded in each Armenian household. Now, to make more items, Artur needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artur in purchasing gravestones and stones for making different sculptures and selling them locally. Artur hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for gravestones and stones

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pots, pans, rice and oil.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIA AUXILIADORA” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisol es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa usada, venta de refrescos, venta de galletas, artesano de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisol es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa y cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una tía hace diez años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en: The Maria Auxiliadora communal bank will start their thirty-first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional hub. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a governing board, where Marisol is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied. Among them are a neighborhood store, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, used clothing sales, soft drink sales, cookie sales, and shoemaking. The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-business owners. Marisol is a member of this group. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling clothing and cosmetics. She says that she learned this business from an aunt ten years ago. The loan that she will take out is to increase capital (buy clothing) which she will buy wholesale at the traditional fairs and later sell in her establishment. This kind of work lets her earn income to support her family, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been involved in tthe retail business for 5 years now. She is selling clothing and dressmaking supplies from her house and gathering income for her family. LIlit is a mother of two little children (the elder one is in the photo) and lives together with her husband.

Now this hardworking mother needs financial support to be able to purchase new stock of clothing and meet her clients' needs.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Lilit to be able to meet client demand and earn higher income for her family.

She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for selling to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: Doña Maria de 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 6 años de edad, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, adicional a eso  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de atoles, es una persona dedicada a su trabajo, amable con buena moral, gracias a todas estas características ha logrado una gran demanda en la venta de sus productos y sus cosechas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas  ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de formula, sulfato, semillas, abonos, etc.  para el cultivo de maíz, y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se  merece.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and three children aged 16, 15 and 6 years old. She has been growing corn for several years. When the harvest is ready she stores it in silos like the one in the photograph. In addition to this, she also sells all kinds of atoles (hot drinks made with cornflour). She is dedicated to her work, friendly, and has good morals. Thanks to these characteristics she has managed to gain a large demand for her products and her crops. With the income from her sales, she has managed to cover a lot of her household bills.

Doña Maria is asking for a loan so that she can buy formula, sulphate, seeds, fertilizer etc. for growing corn, and in this way increase her income so that she can give her family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy formula, sulphate, seeds, fertilizer etc.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is a 36-year-old woman live in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school; she is single with 8 children between 15 to 21, two of her children are living on their own. For the past 6 years she has been selling spoons, bowls, and plates in the local market. Sometimes sales are slow, but most of the time she realizes profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates for her business; she hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates for her business

loans.name: Mayamu

texts.en:
Mayamu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old and married, with two children ages 15 and 17 who are in school and live at home.
For the past year she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita (a juice drink), and other items. She received a little amount from her husband to start this business, and she learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, etc. to expand her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, etc. to expand her business

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a private entrepreneur from the village of Lernagog in Armavir region. She lives with her daughter and son. The latter has migrated to Russia as he couldn't find any employment opportunities in his homeland to be able to take care of the family. 

Gayane currently runs a small local store where she sells different grocery products, some clothes, and glassware. The assortment of goods she sells in the store is not that big and needs to be updated from time to time in order for the store to function properly. 

Gayane now needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase new goods (grocery products, clothes and glassware) to resell in her small store. She and her family greatly rely on the goodwill of the lenders who support them to collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their small business.

loans.use: to purchase new goods (grocery products, clothes and glassware) to resell in her small store.

loans.name: Amalia Patricia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer casada de 29  años de edad, madre de dos niños de 7 y 3 años de edad, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Una mujer trabajadora que lucha junto a su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado a un costado de su vivienda. 
Ella empezó esta actividad desde hace 5 años ya que en su comunidad no había ni una tienda cercana,  es por ello que tomo la iniciativa de emprender este negocio para que las personas tengan todo lo necesario sin tener que salir a otro lugar.
Comenta que esta actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias que le han servido para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario, solo de esta manera podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es generar más ganancias para poder construir su vivienda y así brindarle una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Amalia is 29 years old, and married with two children aged 7 and 3. They live in the Sololá department. She is a hard working woman who struggles alongside her husband to get their family ahead. Currently she has a grocery store which is located next to her house.

She started the business 5 years ago, since in her community there was only one shop nearby, and so she took the initiative to start the business so that people would have everything they need without having to go elsewhere.

She says that this work has been a good source of income and that it has been enough to cover their household expenses. This is why she is now asking for a loan of 5,000 GTQ to buy everyday consumable goods. Only this way will she be able to give her customers a better service.

Her biggest dream is to increase her earnings so that she can build her own home and so make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, coffee and detergent, fresh fish and food for her family

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 44-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years, she has been operating a clinic. She started the business in order to bring medical services nearer to the community since most public hospitals were far. 

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attend degrees as minimum qualification, and expand her medical services to the nearby communities. 

Rebecca intends to use the loan facility to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram is from the city of Goris, which is in Armenia's Syuniq region. His family consists of his wife, daughter and son. He works in the private sector, for a construction company. The family's main breadwinners are Aram and his daughter, who also works in the private sector, but their salaries are not enough to fully cover the family's daily expenses. Aram generates additional income by breeding piglets and growing grass. He currently wants to develop his livestock-breeding business to find new sources of income for his family. To reach that goal he needs a loan of $2,000 to buy two cows. His enlarged herd will help the family take care of its needs more effectively. He and his family will be very thankful to all the lenders who help them collect they money they need to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Astaluz

texts.en:
Astaluz is a 50-year-old single woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years, she has been practicing agriculture and earning a salary as a civil servant.

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university and set up sustainable income-generating activities for them. She also desires to venture into commercialized agriculture despite inadequate capital.

Astaluz intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hrantik

texts.en:
Hrantik is an experienced farmer from the village Khndzoresk of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, daughter and three sons (one of them is a school-age boy and the youngest son is one year old). To take care of his big family, Hrantik is engaged in breeding cattle of twenty cows. The latter is the most important source of family's income. 

Hrantik now needs to enlarge the cattle a little bit. To reach that goal, he needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase two more cows and buy some forage for the cattle. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, he wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Hrantik was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The Second-Chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Hrantik and his big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows and buy some forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Zepher

texts.en: Zepher is a 54-year-old married man with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For 15 years he earned a living by selling clothes, and with the money he made was able to buy land and start farming. Ever-changing customer preferences and price fluctuations affect his business, but he continues to work hard to achieve his dreams of educating his children and owning a boutique. Zepher intends to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Janna

texts.en: Zhanna is a young agronomist from the village of Nor Kyurin in the Ararat region. She lives with her parents and husband. The family is engaged in breeding cows and hens, and this is their only source of income. Their barn is in very poor condition and makes it difficult for them to work effectively. Also, things are getting more expensive day by day, and they need to enlarge their agribusiness to be able to cover their expenses. That is why Zhanna needs a loan of $3,000 to renovate her barn, buy more cows and pay for forage for her livestock. This is her’s first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF which provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit before, because they have no credit history. Zhanna and her family will be very thankful to their lenders for their good will in helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate her barn, buy cows and pay for forage.

loans.name: Sajama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAJAMA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Santusa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de ferretería, tienda de barrio, crianza de llamas, venta de refrescos, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Santusa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción que realizó la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que implementó al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos por un negocio semejante en la zona y la necesidad de generar mayor economía en su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frescos, arroz, fideo) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área la capacitación, el ahorro y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "SAJAMA" are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. The group is made up of eight members and is run buy an executive board of which Señora Santusa is President. The businesses run by the group's members are wide ranging, and include: a hardware store, a corner shop, raising llamas, selling cold drinks, selling detergents.

The loan they are applying for will benefit this group of women with small businesses, of which Señora Santusa is a member. She says that this is the first time they are joining Pro Mujer, through the invitation of an advert that the institution placed in their area. Currently she has a corner shop that she started when she saw her neighbour's need for one in the area and the need to increase her family's income.

The loan that Señora Santusa will receive will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy drinks, rice, and noodles, which she will acquire at the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then sell in her sales space. This kind of work will allow her to earn an income to support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has 4 children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Santusa answered that she likes the training, the savings and the health service.

loans.use: to buy drinks, rice and noodles.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en: Bruno is 28 years old, he is married and has four children. He deals in coffee and also rides a motorcycle (boda boda) to supplement the income. He started the business because of his background from a rural setting. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and coffee seedlings. He hopes to have a coffee plantation, his challenge is changes in climate. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish net, lead weights and nylon

loans.name: Asa

texts.en: Asa is a married man with three children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. For a year he has been running a retail shop but also practices farming and has rental houses to earn extra income. Like most traders in the business he is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuation, while his dreams are to own a wholesale shop. Asa intends to use the loan to buy soda,salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, uno de 12 años y el otro de 7 años, habitan en casa propia; ella posee una pequeña tienda y además vende pupusas los fines de semana, su esposo es transportista con eso ayuda en los gastos del hogar, les ha sido difícil salir adelante pero unidos siempre han logrado impulsar a su pequeña familia; Ana es una mujer dedicada, responsable pero sobre todo muy humilde, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona fuera de la ciudad, desde hace algún tiempo quiere levantar una pared en la casa para hacer división, quiere empezar con el trabajo lo más pronto posible ya que por el momento solo tienen una madera grande colocada como pared, no posee de suficiente capital para cubrir los gastos de material, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, grava. Ana Leticia está muy contenta con la ayuda y se hace responsable de cancelar.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia is 33 years old and lives with her partner and two children ages 12 and 7. They live in their own home, she owns a small shop and also sells pupusas at the weekends. Her husband is a transporter. With her work she helps with the household expenses, as it has been very difficult to get ahead, but together they have always managed to drive their small family forward. Ana is a dedicated woman, responsible but above all humble. 

Her home is located in an area outside the city, and for some time she has wanted to build a dividing wall in the house. She wants to start the work as soon as possible, since at the moment they only have a wooden divide as a wall, but she doesn't have enough capital to cover the material costs. This is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and gravel. Ana Leticia is very happy with the help and is taking on the responsibility of repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en: Lilit is from the village Tolors of Syuniq region. She lives with her father. Lilit and her father work in the private sector. However their salaries are very low and they are hardly able to make ends meet and to take care of themselves. They breed a livestock of sheep and hens; they are also engaged in cultivation of wheat and potatoes. Livestock breeding and plant cultivation are important sources of income for the family. To be able to meet the growing needs of her family Lilit now wants to enlarge the livestock. To reach that goal she needs a loan of USD 1500 to buy two calves. It will help her greatly to sustain and develop her agribusiness. Lilit and her father will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will in helping them to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fish net and crab traps.

loans.name: Mavis Group

texts.en:
Mavis, who is 33, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been selling wigs for eight years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She is standing second from left in the photograph.

This will be Mavis's second loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of a variety of wigs. She has repaid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, and help her husband with household expenses. She will use this loan to buy additional stock of the wigs. She dreams of finishing her house to build a shop for her business.

Mavis is receiving this loan with other members who will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of GHS 2100.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of wigs.

loans.name: Alain Pascal

texts.en: Alain is a Cameroonian aged thirty-nine, married with two children. The oldest is fourteen and in secondary school while the youngest is six years old and in primary school. He has been in this business for the past five years, which makes him stable and experienced. This business is successful because it is located in an urban area where the demand is high. He is likely to succeed because of his very long experience in the business. This loan, to buy female rabbits for reproduction, will increase his profit by 13 percent as well as his standard of living

loans.use: To buy female rabbits for reproduction

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en: Sasun is from Akhtala city of Lori region. His family consists of his elderly pensioner mother (in the photo), his wife and three school age children (elder son is in the photo). Sasun and his family breed a livestock of cows, pigs and hens. They are also engaged in beekeeping and cultivation of several fruits (peach, cherry, plum, quince, pomegranate, fig, blood orange and walnut). Livestock breeding and horticulture are the most important sources of income for the family. To sustain and continue his agribusiness Sasun needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase four pigs, to buy forage for the livestock and to make credit repayments. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work, Sasun was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Sasun and his big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs, to buy forage for the livestock and to make credit repayments

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en: Manushak is an agronomist from the village Chiva of Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and two little sons (8 and 2 years old). Manushak works in the local school. The salary she gets there is very low, and it is impossible to meet the family's daily needs with that salary. With the help of her husband Manushak breeds a livestock of cows and hens. The family is also engaged in cultivation of several fruits (peach, apricot, apple, pear and walnut). Those are the most important sources of family's income. As the family's everyday costs are increasing day by day, they need to find more sources of income to meet their needs. Manushak currently needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase a cow and calf, to buy forage for the livestock and to pay for the harvesting services. She and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for supporting them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and calf, to buy forage for the livestock and to pay for the harvesting services

loans.name: Tywah

texts.en:
Here is 42-year-old Tywah. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado County due to good roads, quietness, and a lower housing prices.
 
Tywah is married with 5 children between the ages of 12 and 27. Only three live at home and attend school. 

For the past 2 years, Tywah has been selling nails, door locks, hinges etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She works 6 days a week, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more nails, door locks, hinges, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more nails, door locks, hinges, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Peruz

texts.en: Peruz is an agronomist from the village Nor Armavir of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and elderly father. Peruz's husband is a contractual serviceman in the army. Peruz is engaged in breeding livestock: cows, pigs, piglets and hens. She is also cultivating grapes. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. To continue developing it, Peruz needs some financial assistance. She particularly needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase two calves, to buy forage for the livestock, and to pay for the harvesting services. As this is Peruz’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Peruz and her family greatly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for assisting them to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two calves, to buy forage for the livestock and to pay for the harvesting services

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer who is 42 years old. He has 3 children aged 14, 12, and 9. He grows maize and beans and rears cattle. He also does brick laying and sells charcoal. His clients are his fellow farmers.

Moses began the business to support his family. He will use the loan to buy more land for cultivation. He is hardworking and wants to maintain a partnership with Kiva through good repayments.

loans.use: to buy more land.

loans.name: Vigilina

texts.en:
Vigilina is 36 years old and is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 8 children. Her eldest is 20 and her youngest is 1 year old. 

Vigilina and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for many years now. This is their main livelihood to support the family. 

Vigilina is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net and nylon. She will be able to catch more fish than before with the use of a new and sturdy fishing net. The income that will be generated from fishing will be used to buy healthy meals for the family and pay for school fees.

In the future, Vigilina hopes to see her children successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and nylon.

loans.name: Maima F.

texts.en:
Maima is 43 years old and lives in Caldwell. This area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado County due to good roads, quietness, and lower housing prices. 

Maima is married and has a 12-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

For the past 4 years, she has been selling slippers in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday. Her main challenges are the high price of slippers and sometimes she has fewer customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She plans to save and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from the village Eraskhavan in the Ararat region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and 1-year-old granddaughter. 

Anahit's son and daughter-in-law work in the village self governance body. However, their salaries are so low that they cannot meet the family's daily needs. 

Anahit breeds a cow; she is also engaged in cultivation of wheat and alfalfa. Anahit's small agribusiness needs some investment now to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family enabling them to purchase wheat seeds, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, pay the water bills and the workforce, as well as renovate the barn. 

Anahit and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for supporting them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, pay the water bills and the workforce, as well as renovate the barn.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: María Paz de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida de 48 años y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y gaseosas  todos los días, y su esposo le ayuda con su trabajo de vigilante, entre los dos logran salir adelante. María es una mujer dedica a  su labor y a su familia, quiere lo mejor para ellos y se los da en la medida de sus posibilidades, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural, es una casa muy humilde y algo pequeña, necesitan más espacio para mayor comodidad, por eso se decidió a construir un nuevo cuarto necesitan de varios materiales pero no poseen de capital, debido a su condición económica, le ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito para la construcción de la primera fase del cuarto levantar las paredes y encementar el piso, se comprara cemento, grava, arena, ladrillos y hierro. María Paz se siente muy alegre con la ayuda, y les agradecerá cancelando cada uno de los pagos.
texts.en:
María Paz is 45-years-old and lives with her husband who is 48-years-old along with her three kids in the same house. She works selling tortillas and soda every day. Her husband helps her financially with his job as a watchman. Between the two of them, they manage to get ahead. María is a woman devoted to her work and family and wants the best for them. She provides for them based on the means that she has. 

Her housing is located in a rural area. It's a pretty small and simple house. They need greater space for more comfort. That’s why they’ve decided to build an additional room. They need different kinds of building materials but they don't have the money due to their economic situation. 

She has asked for a loan from FUSAI for the first construction phase of the add-on room. This will consist of raising the walls and setting in the concrete for the floor. They will buy cement, gravel, sand, bricks, and iron. María Paz feels very happy with the help and will be very thankful. She will pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Ilusión Los Lobos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Ilusión los Lobos” se encuentra en una comunidad muy alejada del municipio, para llagar hasta donde se reúne el grupo se necesita de transporte especial. Es un lugar muy bonito, se caracteriza por tener mucha vegetación y una gran cantidad de árboles. En la comunidad aún se habla la lengua mazahua. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron por dos razones "Ilusión" porque quieren progresar y sobresalir pero también por el nombre de un lugar muy especial para todos ellos "Los Lobos". La señora Avelina es la representante del grupo, ella es muy sonriente, siempre está de muy buen humor y su alegría se contagia a la hora de platicar con ella. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Francisco desde hace ya 27 años y juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos de los cuales ya solo dos dependen de dicha pareja y aún asisten a la escuela. Doña Ave, como le llaman, se dedica a la cría, engorda y venta de cerdos desde hace ya 10 años; los compra con un proveedor de Michoacán quien se los deja más baratos. Doña Ave comenta “Inicie mi actividad de los cerdos porque una señora me vendió una cerdita solo tenía curiosidad, pero esa cerdita ya venía cargada: tuvo nueve cerditos". Ave crió y vendió los animalitos y obtuvo buenas ganancias, fue así que decidió dedicarse de lleno a la actividad. Estos animales son comprados desde muy chicos con apenas cuarenta días de nacidos durante cuatro o cinco meses los alimenta con maíz y cuando alcanzan un peso más de 100 kilos los ofrecen para venderlos. En esta ocasión, Ave está solicitando un crédito para comprar material como cemento, varilla, cal, block para la construcción de sus saudas aunque por el momento no tiene ningún cerdo está pensando que los comprará en el mes de diciembre, pero quiere tener un lugar ya bien establecido. En el mes de agosto terminó de vender sus 10 cerdos. Doña Ave está muy contenta porque gracias a su esfuerzo han podido levantar sus casas de material más reforzado. “Anteriormente mis hijos, esposo y yo vivíamos solo en unas casas de madera pero desde que iniciamos con la cría de estos animales hemos podido levantar nuestra casa de colado”. Al parecer no presenta ningún reto importante en su actividad. Doña Ade comenta “Mi sueño es poder terminar nuestra casa en un segundo nivel para vivir cómodamente con toda mi familia incluso mis nietos, pero también me gustaría que mis niños terminaran de estudiar y si se puede, que estudien una carrera profesional.” Las integrantes del grupo son Doña Margarita y Rosa quienes invertirán en la cría, engorda y venta de sus borregos.
texts.en:
The "Ilusión los Lobos" group is in a remote community away from the town. To get there, the group needs special transportation. It's a beautiful place, known for having a variety of vegetation and many trees. They speak the Mazahua language in the community. They chose the group's name because of the two meanings of "Ilusión" and because they want to progress and stand out, but also for a place that is special to all of them, "Los Lobos."

Avelina is a member of the group. She loves to smile and is always in a good mood. Her happiness is contagious when talking to her. She is 42, and has been married to Francisco for 27 years. They have six children, two of whom are dependents and in school. Ave, as she's known, works by growing, fattening, and selling pigs. She has done this for ten years. She buys the pigs from a vendor in Michoacán, who sells them at a low price. Ave says, "I started my work with pigs because a woman sold me a small pig because I was interested. However, that pig was heavy and had nine piglets." Ave raised and sold them and earned some income. This is when she decided to make a living from this work. She buys the animals at a young age, barely 40 days old. For four to five months, she feeds them corn and when they reach 100 kilos, she puts them up for sale.

Currently, Ave is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as cement, spokes, lime powder, and blocks to build a larger space for her pigs. Right now, she doesn't have any pigs, but she's thinking she will buy them in December. First, though, she needs an established space. In August, she finished selling off ten pigs. Ave is very happy because thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve her house with better materials. "Before having children, my husband and I lived in a house made of wood, but since we started raising animals, we've been able to build this plaster house." There doesn't seem to be any particular challenge in her work. Ave says, "My dream is to finish our house with a second level so we can live comfortably with everyone, including our grandchildren. But I'd also like my children to finish school if they can, that they study a professional career path." The other group members are Margarita and Rose, who will invest in raising, fattening, and selling their sheep.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as blocks, cement, lime powder, wire, and more.

loans.name: Mo Shakti Group

texts.en:
Seema is about 32 years old and lives with her husband and four children at JK Pur in Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. She has one son and three daughters. The lady standing at the middle with a raised hand is Seema. 

Seema has been running a fast food stall for the last seven years with the some indirect support from her husband. Her husband is a daily laborer. From the above, her family gets a monthly income of 5,000 INR (Indian rupees), which makes it very difficult to maintain her family. Seema wants to send her children to a better school for a better education. After the expansion of the business, she has a plan to do so. She has an ambition to establish a full-fledged meals hotel at JK Pur.

It is the first time Seema and four other members of her locality want a loan from Mahashakti. All of them have their established businesses and the same economic status.   

From this loan, Seema wants to purchase some utensils and gram flour, oil, whole wheat, kerosene oil, etc. for the growth of her fast food business. 

Other members of the group, Kasturi, Kuni, Jayanti and Mamata, have a cloth store, water pipe business, grocery shop and vegetable business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase some utensils and gram flour, oil, whole wheat, kerosene oil, etc.

loans.name: Tiruhi

texts.en: Tiruhi is an experienced farmer from the village of Karmravan in the  Shirak region. She lives with her husband, who helps her greatly in farming activities.  Tiruhi breeds cows and calves; she is also engaged in cultivation of grass and alfalfa. Those are the only sources of the family’s income. As the autumn is progressing, Tiruhi needs to purchase forage for the livestock and to organize the harvesting of grass and alfalfa. To reach that goal, there is a need of a loan of $3,000 to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for the harvesting and transportation services for alfalfa and grass. The loan will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, and they will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for the harvesting and transportation services of alfalfa and grass

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  es un hombre soltero de 39 años de edad, padre de 4 niñas menores de edad actualmente no estudian, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, frijol y papa en una parcela que tiene a un costado de su vivienda. Comenta que desde hace 15 años viene realizando este tipo de actividad  ya que su papa le enseño esta labor cuando él era pequeño.
A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia. Por lo que ha observado que en esta temporada del año hay una fuerte demanda, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizante para poder cultivarlo y venderlo y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es construir su vivienda para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 39, is single. He is four children, who are all minors. They are not in school right now. They live in the Department of Sololá.

He makes a living by farming onions, beans, and potatoes on a parcel of land that he has on the side of his house. He indicates that he has worked in agriculture for 15 years because his father taught him these skills when he was young.

With this work, he earns enough income to help him contribute to his family's finances. From what he has seen, there is a high demand this season, which is why he is requesting a loan of 3,000.00 Q to buy potato seeds and fertilizer to harvest and sell. This will allow him to earn more income.

His biggest dream is to build a home to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es: Maximino de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, sus hijos y sus nietos en casa propia, el es maestro de obra trabaja en promedio 8 meses al año, además su hija le ayuda con los gastos del hogar; Maximino es un hombre muy emprendedor y responsable; su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural, es muy humilde y algo pequeña, desde hace algún tiempo el quiere construir un muro de retención para mayor seguridad, pero debido a su situación económica no ha contado con los recursos suficientes, desea realizar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero necesita capital para la compra de materiales, por eso solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro, se ahorrara la mano de obra. Maximino está muy contento con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar en el periodo establecido.
texts.en:
Maximino is 60-years-old and lives together with his wife,  kids, and grandchildren in the same house. He works as a general contractor for about 8 months of the year. In addition, his daughter helps him with the housing expenses. Maximino is a man who is very business-minded and responsible. His home is located in a rural area and is very simple and a quite small. 

For some time, he has wanted to build a retaining wall for greater safety but because of his economic situation he hasn't had the sufficient funds. He wants to carry out the work as soon as possible but he needs capital to purchase the materials. That's why he has asked for a loan from FUSAI which would allow him to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron. He will save on using labor. Maximino is very happy with the support and agrees to pay off his loan within the set period.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Sai Ram Group

texts.en:
Sumitra, aged about 42 years, is residing with her one son, aged about 6 years, and one daughter, aged about 18 years, at JK Pur of Rayagada district in Odisha, India. She is a widow. The lady standing second from the left with a raised hand in the photograph is Sumitra. 

For the last eight years, Sumitra has been running a grocery shop. Her income per month is about Rs. 5,000 (INR/Indian rupees). According to Sumitra, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

It is the first time the group members will take a loan from Mahashakti. From the present loan, Sumitra wants to purchase rice, sugar, soap, oil, washing powder, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, dry chili, spices powder, etc. for her grocery shop. Some part of the loan will be invested for the repairing of the shop. Sumitra has an ambition to give a better education to her son for his bright future, which she could not do for her daughter due to financial crises of the family.

The other three members of the group, Laxmi, Gouri and Sita, need loans for a hotel, tailoring and grocery shop respectively.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soap, oil, washing powder, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, dry chili, spices powder, etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 57 años de edad, esta acompañado, tiene 7 hijos, 3 de ellos mayores de edad. Como su familia era de bajos recursos Juan  no pudo estudiar porque tenia que trabajar con su padre para  ayudar con  los ingresos de la familia.

Juan es agricultor, Oficio que aprendio de su padre, por el momento tiene sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maìz. Tambien cria ganado, todos los dias se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para ordeñar las vacas, las deja en el lugar donde se alimentaran y se va a trabajar en su cultivo, para eso camina un kilometro desde su casa.


El Préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de insumos agricolas; abonos, fertilizantes,  y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de 7,000 mts cuadrados  de maiz, y lograr tener una  cosecha  mayor y tener mejores ingresos para su familia.

Tiene como meta personal, que sus hijos terminen la universidad y tengan mas oportunidades de trabaja de la que tuvo èl.
texts.en:
Juan, 57, is in a common law marriage. He has seven children, three of whom are adults. Because his family had limited resources, he couldn't go to school and instead had to work with his father to help with the family income.

Juan is a farmer, a skill he learned from his father. He currently has 14,000 square meters of corn planted. He also raises cattle. Every day, he wakes up at three in the morning to milk the cows. He leaves them in the place where they eat and goes to work on his land, which is a mile from his house.

This loan will be used to buy farming products such as fertilizer and to prepare his land for planting 7,000 square meters of corn. This will give him a better harvest and bring more income to his family.

As a personal goal, he wants his children to graduate from college and have more opportunities for work than he had himself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Jai Jagannath Group

texts.en:
Ranju lives in the small village of Hata Muniguda in the district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. She is a headstrong and confident lady. The lady standing in the middle with a raised hand in the photo is Ranju. She is 41 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter, aged about 4 years, and one son, aged about 7 years. 

Ranju has been running a tent house business for the last five years with the hand-holding support of her husband. She gets a monthly income of Rs. 9,000 (INR/Indian rupees) from the above business. Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household expenses. As she could not make ends meet with her income, she was not able to save for future uncertainties. 

In the year 2009, Ranju, along with other women of the locality, formed a group named Jai Jagannath to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. Now Ranju wants a fourth-cycle loan for the growth of her business. She wants to provide her children a better education. 

With this loan, Ranju wants to purchase utensils, plastic chairs, cotton side-wall, etc. for the tent house.

The other four members of the group, Jibeswari, Archana, Suprabha and Tulashi, want a loan for a fast food hotel, grocery shop, broiler business and milk business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase  utensils, plastic chairs, cotton side-wall, etc. for her tent house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his business

loans.name: Patrick Olimi

texts.en:
Patrick is a 46-year-old married man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has received a previous loan that he used to buy land. For the past six years, Patrick has operated a taxi transport business and he also is a farmer. He started his transportation business using personal savings and loans from Hofokam. Patrick's financial hardships include high taxes and fuel costs.

Patrick is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. His future dreams are to build a permanent home, expand his farming activities, and to have his children attain degrees as their minimum qualifications.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jumakhon

texts.ru: Чумахон 44 года. Он заботливый муж и отец двух детей. Его сыну 19 лет, дочери 15 лет. Чумахон со своей семьей проживает в городе Куляб. В данный момент он планирует начать новый бизнес. Он имеет мастерство и опыт по изготовлению сундука и теперь хотел бы на этом построить свой бизнес. Чумахон просит кредит для приобретения лесоматериалов, гвоздей и красок для производства сундука. Он уже во дворе дома построил помещение для мастерской. Он будет работать в своей мастерской вместе с сыном и планирует в день изготавливать по два сундука. Чумахон считает это интересным и прибыльным делом.
texts.en: Jumakhon is 44 years old. He is a caring husband and the father of two. His son is 19 years old, and his daughter is 15. Jumakhon lives in the town of Kulob with his family. At present he plans to launch a new business. He has the skills and experience in manufacturing storage chests, and would like to focus his business on this product. Jumakhon is applying for a loan to buy wood, nails and paint in order to manufacture storage chests. He has already built a shed for his work shop in the yard of his house. He will work in the shop together with his son, and plans to complete two storage chests per day. Jumakhon believes this work to be interesting and profitable.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and paint to manufacture storage chests.

loans.name: Dhaneswar

texts.en:
Dhaneswar is a 36-year-old differently able person living with his parents, wife and a son who is eight years old. He is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs and saris (Indian traditional dress for women). His parents and his wife are helping him with the weaving. 

The financial condition of his family is not so good. He brings raw materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him. In return, he gets only the labor cost, which is very little. He has a plan to buy raw material directly from the market and sell back the finished product in the market. Doing this will increase his income. 

He has requested a loan of 30,000 INR (Indian rupees) to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs and saris. He wants to develop his business and provide a better living style for his family. He also wants to save some money for his family’s future and see his son go to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs and saris (Indian traditional dress for women).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old and is married with children who are between nine and 14 years old. Her children live with her and go to school. Alice lives in the community surrounding Airport of Liberia. She stopped her education after the ninth grade. For the past ten years, Alice has been selling rice, milk, candy, biscuits, bread, and other items in the local market. Her biggest business challenge is the rainy season. Alice likes her business because it provides for her needs.

Alice is requesting a loan to purchase rice, milk, candy, biscuits, bread, and other items. In the future, she plans to send her children to college and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, milk, candy, biscuits, bread, and other items

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
German de 38 años de edad, es soltero, tiene una hija que ya es independiente. Por motivos de bajos recursos economicos solo estudio hasta tercer grado y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a la familia. Hoy en dia vive solo, tuvo que separarce de su esposa.

Es agricultor, trabaja desde los 11 años de edad con su padre del que aprendio todo lo que sabe. Trabaja de lunes a sabado, camina 45 minutos para llegar al lugar donde tiene el cultivo. Tuvo que dedicarce a la agricultura de subsistencia debido a su poca formacion educativa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, con lo que procura asegurar el alimento para el otro año y tener grano para venta. 

Con su trabajo espera poder  y mejorar su vivienda, que se encuentra en mal estado,  es de bahareque y en la época lluviosa tiende a deteriorarse.
texts.en: German, 38, is single and has a daughter who is already independent. Because he had few economic resources, he only went to school until the third grade and had to work to help his family. Today he lives alone. He had to separate from his wife. He is a farmer. Since the age of 11, he has worked with his father, who taught him all he knows. He works from Monday to Saturday. He walks 45 minutes to get to the place where his crops are. He had to work in subsistence agriculture due to his lack of education. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and to pay workers to sow 7,000 square meters of beans, with which he will be able to get food for the other year and have grain to sell. With his work, he hopes to be able to improve his home, which is in a bad state. It is made of bahareque [interwoven sticks and mud] and in the rainy season it tends to get damages.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay laborers

loans.name: Narayan

texts.en:
Narayan is a 30-year-old differently able person. He is living with his parents and siblings. He is engaged in maintaining a general store. He is the only earning person in his family, and this business supports and manages his family's monthly expenditures. He sells items like rice, cooking oil, sugar, soap, hair oil, etc. in his general store.

There are 250 potential customers in his village, but he is unable to meet the customer demand. He needs to travel to the nearest market in the village with the help of his brother to refill his stock every day, depending on the demand, as he does not have funds to maintain inventory levels sufficient even for a week. He wants to purchase goods that he sells in his general store, like rice, oil, sugar, etc., in bulk. He can decrease his stock-refilling rate, transportation costs and buying costs. He can meet the demand and earn more from his business, which will help him to control his daily cash flow.

He requested a loan amount of 15,000 INR (Indian rupees) for his business expansion. He wants to give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, flour, biscuits, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Neijay

texts.en: Neijay, a 39-year-old woman, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school. She is married with three children aged between 8 and 20, but she is living on her own. For the past eleven years she has been selling bagged water. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the time she realizes a profit  and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bagged water for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bagged water for  her business,

loans.name: Narmada

texts.en:
Narmada is a 33-year-old widowed woman living with her father-in-law and her children. She is engaged in the activity of decorating and making tent houses for events like marriages and for other Hindu rituals. She has tents, a few musical instruments and speakers with her, which she installs wherever the events are performed. She has eight years of experience in this activity.

She lost her husband in an accident eight years ago. After her husband’s death, all the family responsibilities are taken care of by her. This business was run by her husband, and now she is continuing this business with the help of her father-in-law.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR (Indian rupees) to purchase new upgraded musical instruments and decorative items for her business. Her dream is to see her children get admitted into a good school, and she also wants to save some money for their future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sound system and decorative items for her event management services.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 23-year-old rice and corn farmer from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She has two children ages two and three to support from her businesses of farming rice and operating a Sari-Sari store. 

Mary Jane's partner works as a gasoline boy. They are struggling to keep their farm while meeting the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, canned goods, detergent, coffee, milk and chips.

She knows that with proper care and good growth, attributed to fertilizer, she can be successful in her farming. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm, and canned goods, detergent, coffee, milk and chips for her Sari-Sari store.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам женатый человек в возрасте 52 лет. У него четверо детей. Четыре года назад Акрам отрыл свой продуктовый магазин на родном районе Кубадиён. И посей день магазин работает и предоставляет свои услуги. Акрам сам работает продавцом. И когда он уезжает за продуктами в город его семья заменяет его в магазине. Хоть и магазин Акрама маленький, но он старается, чтоб у него были все необходимые продукты. Скоро Акрам уедит в город и хочет взять кредит чтобы привести новый товар и пополнить свои запасы продуктов.
texts.en:
Akram is a 52-year-old married man and the father of four children.  Four years ago, he opened his own grocery store in his native district of Qubadiyon, and to this day, he is working in his store, serving his customers.  Akram sells his grocery products himself.  However, when he has to go to the city to buy more goods, his family replaces him in his store.

In spite of the small size of his store, Akram tries to have all the basic items.  He will soon make a trip to the city, and he wants to take a loan in order to bring in new merchandise and replenish his stock of grocery products.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and renew his inventory.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a farmer from the village of Bagravan in Shirak region. She lives with her husband, three school-age daughters, and six-year-old son. Hasmik's husband supports her greatly in the everyday farming activities. 

Hasmik is breeding a livestock of cows, calves and hens. She is also involved in cultivation of wheat, barley and grass. Farming is the only source of family income. As the needs of the family are growing day by day, Hasmik needs to enlarge her agribusiness to be able to meet the needs of the family. 

A loan of USD 2,000 will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family, and will enable them to purchase new calves, seeds, forage for the livestock and fuel for the agricultural machinery. 

As this is Hasmik’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

The family will be very thankful to the lenders for supporting them maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase calves, seeds and forage for the livestock, and fuel for the agricultural machinery.

loans.name: John Sebastian

texts.es:
El  es John Sebastián, se inscribió para Mecánica Automotriz. Decidió estudiar este programa porque a  él siempre le ha llamado la atención todo lo que tenga que ver con carros, aunque no tiene vehículo decidió estudiar para conocer más de ellos y aparte poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos, con los cuales puede ayudar a mejorar su calidad de vida, también decidió estudiar esto por sus padres a los cuales les gusta la carrera y deciden apoyarlo de la mejor manera posible. 
John tiene todo el interés de iniciar y finalizar este programa de la mejor manera posible, respondiendo con las mejores notas para obtener  un excelente conocimiento y de esa manera aportar sus conocimientos a personas que quizás lleguen a necesitar de él.
John desea darles la alegría a sus padres de  saber que fue un excelente estudiante y que sus esfuerzos por colaborarle no fueron en vano.
El proyecto a corto plazo que tiene John es ingresar a una empresa grande y de nombre para poder conseguir una casa propia, y de esta manera devolverles a sus padres todo lo que ellos han hecho por él.
John se siente muy motivado al iniciar sus estudios superiores, y aun más motivado al saber que es un programa de su total agrado, el es consciente que no es fácil pero tampoco es imposible, porque sus deseos de superación son más grandes que los obstáculos que quizás se le presenten en el camino para llegar a ser el mejor de la clase, porque piensa que al ponerse metas grande mañana sus labores asignadas serán superadas por los tropiezos que la vida le ponga.
John desea conseguir sus metas personales con un buen empleo y un mejor ingreso económico de una manera más rápida y transparente. Sus padres son una gran influencia porque aunque ninguno tiene conocimiento sobre mecánica ellos son muy comprometidos a sus trabajos y le han enseñado valores tan grandes como el respeto, la responsabilidad y la pasión por lo que uno debe desempeñar el trabajo asignado.
John con estos ejemplos se siente comprometido a seguir su ejemplo  y dedicación a un trabajo futuro.
texts.en:
This student is John Sebastián and is enrolled in the car mechanic program. He decided to study within this program because he had always been interested in cars. Although he does not have his own vehicle, he chose to study in order to learn more about them and be able to receive greater income with which he can improve his standard of living.
