He also decided to study this because of his parents who also like this career track and decided to support him as best as they could. 

John has every interest in beginning and completing this program as best as he can, getting the best grades possible in order to have a solid knowledge base and in this way support those who require his support. John wishes to make his parents happy to know that he was an excellent student and that their efforts to support him were not in vain. 

John's short term plans are to enter a large and well known business to be able to have his own house. In this way his will return to his parents everything that they have done for him. John is very motivated to begin his advanced education and ever more motivated to know that he is completely content with the program. He is conscious that it is not easy but it is also not impossible because his desire to get ahead is greater than the obstacles that he might face to reach the top of his class. He believes that by setting greater goals, tomorrow his work will be greater for the hurdles that life throws at him. 

John hopes to achieve his personal goals with a good job and greater income quickly and fairly. His parents are his greatest influence on him because although neither knows anything about mechanics, they are both very committed to their jobs and have taught him great values including respect, responsbility and passion for what he chooses to do in life. With these role models, John is committed to following their example and dedication to his future work.

loans.use: to study within the mechanics program at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Gloria Alexsandra

texts.es:
Alexandra es una persona luchadora incansable, que desde los 18 años comenzó a trabajar; y en ese año terminó su grado once en la jornada nocturna, de esta manera podía aportar económicamente en su casa sin truncar la culminación de su bachillerato.
Luego en el año 2001 intento  estudiar e ingreso a la Fundación Universitaria Monserrate en el programa de Trabajo social el cual pagaba con el esfuerzo de su trabajo hasta que lo perdió, en el quinto semestre no tenia como continuar pagando ni siquiera financiado y su familia no podía colaborarle ya que no estaban en la mejor situación económica. Pasaron varios meses sin ubicación laboral, luego de tres años cuando vio que ya había mejorado la situación fue al la decanatura y la respuesta era que ya había cambiado el pensum y debía comenzar de nuevo desde primero, ella decidió dejar así 
Desde entonces ha tenido que trabajar en lo que le sale por lo general con salario mínimo, no ha podido ubicarse bien laboralmente por falta de estudios superiores, siempre ha soñado con estudiar donde pueda ayudar a las personas y obtener una entrada económica solvente . por esto ha decidido estudiar Salud Oral
Alexsandra continua con su deseo de superación , ahora con más motivos , quiere estudiar su carrera con la cual pueda desempeñarse muy profesionalmente , poder forjar un mejor futuro para ella junto con un buen desarrollo para su hija, un crecimiento en un entorno adecuado y una buena educación para que sea una gran persona; esto incluye valores , afecto, estabilidad, un techo donde vivir dignamente, un medio de transporte, recreación y por supuesto poder compartir todo esto con su familia que tanto la han apoyado, de esta manera ayudar a mejorar el estilo de vida de todos.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a tireless fighter, who started working at the age of 18; that year she went to night school to finish 11th grade so she would be able to support her family financially without having to leave high school early.  Then, in 2001 she tried to go back to school and enrolled in a social work program at Monserrate University Foundation.  She worked very hard to pay for school until, in the fifth semester, she was no longer able to continue paying, even with funding, and her family wasn't able to help because they weren't in the best financial situation.  She went a few months without a job.  After three years, when she saw her situation had improved, she approached the dean's office but they told her the curriculum had changed and she would have to start all over again, so she decided to drop out.

Since then she has had to work wherever she could, usually for minimum salary.  Because she lacks a higher education she has not been able to land a good job.  She has always dreamed of being able to help people and having a reliable income, so she decided to study oral health.  

Alexandra maintains her desire to overcome, and now with more cause, wants to get her degree so she can perform more professionally and forge a better future for herself.  She also wants to raise her daughter in a suitable environment with a good education so she can grow into a great person.  This includes  values, affection, stability, a decent home to live in, a means of transportation, recreation, and of course, sharing everything with her family who have given her so much support so she can help improve the quality of life for everyone.

loans.use: studies in Campoalto

loans.name: Dolores Ezequiel

texts.es: Dolores Ezequiel de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida de 35 años y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad en casa propia. El es vigilante privado, además es agricultor siembra granos básicos para el consumo, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos del hogar trabajando en una maquila; Dolores sabe que no es fácil salir adelante, pero se mantiene constante en el trabajo, siempre buscando oportunidades que le den una vida mejor; su vivienda está ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad, en una zona rural, la casa es un poco pequeña y como es una familia grande quiere empezar a construir un cuarto que les de mas espacio y comodidad, no posee los fondos necesarios para los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita construir la primera fase del cuarto, levantar paredes, y encementar el piso, comprara ladrillo, cemento, hierro, arena y grava. Dolores Ezequiel está muy feliz con la ayuda y espera corresponder con todos los pagos.
texts.en:
Dolores Ezequiel is a 39-years-old who lives together in his own house with his 35-years-old wife and their four children who are minors. He works as a private watchman. In addition, he works as a farmer by planting basic grains for consumption. His wife helps him with the housing expenses with her job at an assembly plant. 

Dolores knows that it isn't easy getting ahead but wants to keep steady at work. He is always looking for opportunities that can improve his life. His house is located in the outskirts of the city in a rural area. The house is a little small and since he has a big family, he wants to start building a room that would give them additional space and comfort. 

He doesn't have the necessary funds for the materials. That is why he's asking for a loan from FUSAI which would allow him to start the initial phase of the room.  This will include putting up the walls and setting in the cement on the floor. He will buy brick, cement, iron, sand, and gravel. Dolores Ezqequiel is very happy with the support and expects to pay back the entire loan.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, iron, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old married woman with six children and two dependents whom she is taking care of after the death of their father. Mary deals in cattle fattening projects in her region. She has managed to help her family financially by providing it with the basic necessities. 

Along side cattle fattening, she also deals in milk sales, and the husband deals in second-hand clothes to bring additional income to the family because all her children attend school. From milk sales, she has managed to pay the tuition for the two dependents.
 
Mary is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy more cows for fattening, as it will enable her to cater for the family's basic necessities of life.
Her major challenge is inadequate pastures to feed her cows, especially in the dry season whereby even some of her animals die due to persistent drought.

Her dream is to own a large farm in the region with at least 500 cows. Mary is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy baby cows that she will breed to fatten.

loans.name: Areg

texts.en: Areg is a young farmer from Teghut village of Lori region. His family consists of his parents and two brothers (the youngest brother is a school age boy). Areg's father works in the copper-molybdenum factory. His salary alone is not enough to meet the family's basic needs. Areg with the help of his family breeds a livestock of calves, sheep, pigs, piglets and hens. He is also involved in beekeeping and cultivation of grass. As Areg's family's daily needs are growing day by day he needs to enlarge the livestock to meet those needs. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a huge help to the family enabling them to purchase seven calves and some barley. Areg and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for helping them to develop and sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seven calves and some barley

loans.name: Konah

texts.en:
You are welcome to meet 37 years old Konah from Liberia; she lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado due to some option such as good roads, quietness, and lower price of house rent. 

She is married to an accountant, they have 4 children between ages 3 months and 18 year, they live at home and only three are currently attending school. Over 2 years now she has been running a table market selling charcoal in the local market, she sells from Monday to Saturday using ten hours. Her main challenges she started in the rainy season, but she makes more profit during this time. She started this business selling for her mother, and learned the business from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business, she plans to build her house and educate all her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is a resident of Caldwell, she is married and has 3 children all of them are adults and all of them are working. For the past three years she has been selling dried goods such as coal, rice, peanuts, candles and diapers. She started this business by selling cookies and bread. One thing she enjoys is that she is relaxed and her business is going fast. She is requesting a loan to purchase coal rice, peanuts, candles and diapers for her business, and she plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase coal rice, peanuts, candles and diapers for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 41-year-old who operates a small pharmacy shop. She is married and they have three children who are school. She is a local trained medic who sells medicine in Teshie. In 2010, because she needed capital to expand her business, she joined ID Ghana after a partner introduced her to ID Ghana. She became interested and joined in November. She is hardworking, industrious and a committed individual ready to support the husband to educate their children. This is her seventh loan and she needs GHS 1800 to buy more medicine to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell to customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
You are welcome to meet 22-year-old Esther from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of house rentals. 

Esther is married and her husband is a driver. They have a two-year-old child who lives at home. For over ten years now she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday using ten hours each day. She stated that her main challenge is the rainy season, but she realizes some profit at that time. She started this business with money from her husband, and learned the business from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house and educate all her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 35 years married with 4 children and 4 other dependents that she is looking after due to financial constraints in the family and due to the death of the parents. She owns a saloon and a cosmetics shop, she also earns rent as another source of income. She has earned a lot from this business. She has been able to pay school fees for her 7 school going children/dependents and also construct houses for rent to add on to this income.

She is applying for a loan of 4,000,000shs to buy materials for finishing up her house - majorly plastering, fixing doors and windows in her house. She is looking forward to the time when the house is complete and she will no longer be renting.

Teopista's major challenge is the seasonality of her business where some times she fetches little profits which can not help in providing all the basic needs for her family and also put back into the business. Her dream is to own the largest saloon and cosmetic shop in her region. She is honest and a hard-working woman.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is 37 year old Eugenia from Liberia; she is married and her husband is a contractor. They have four children aged between 6 and 20, all four of them live at home and currently attend school.  She lives in Caldwell; this area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado due to good roads, quietness, and affordable rent. 
For over ten years now she has been selling soft drinks and cold water in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday for nine hours each day. Her main challenge is the rainy season, but she realizes some profit at that time. She started this business with money from her husband, and learned the  business from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Olga Julieta

texts.es: Olga, labora en el sector de la educación, brindando sus conocimientos para los niños, un empleo muy poco remunerado en nuestro país, ella tiene dos hijos en edad escolar bajo su cargo quienes están estudiando.   Solicita este crédito para realizar el cambio de una pared de madera en la parte de la sala la cual se encuentra en mal estado por el pasar de los años ya dio su vida útil, así también cambiara el techo, que cuyos soporte están deteriorados. Con el financiamiento comprara materiales como laminas de  zinc, piedra cantera, cemento, piedrín y pago de mano de obra, así su familia vivirá más tranquila en un ambiente agradable, seguro y libre de inundaciones.
texts.en: Olga works in the field of education, passing on her knowledge to children. This work is not well-paid in Nicaragua. She has two school-aged children who are dependent on her.  Olga is requesting this loan to undertake the replacement of a wood wall in part of the living room which is in poor condition due to many years in service and also to replace the roof whose structure is deteriorated. With the loan she will buy materials like zinc sheeting, quarry stone, cement, gravel and pay for labor. Her family will be able to live in peace in a pleasant environment, safe and free of flooding.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, quarry stone, cement, gravel and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Roystone

texts.en: Roystone is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as strong and determined. He operates a bicycle transport service where he transports customers using his bicycle. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, who is 51 years old, lives at home with her family. She is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest person.

She owns a business where she sells smoked fish She has had the business for many years. Her friendliness and good prices have attracted many customers.

She requests a loan of GHS 1300 to purchase of two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers. In this way, she will increase her sales and earnings from her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase of two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand is a Cameroonian aged 42. He is married with four children; the oldest is seventeen years and in high school while the youngest is 9 years and in primary school. He is the breadwinner in the family. He has been in this business for over fifteen years which makes him very experienced, stable and the business very profitable. His business is successful because it is situated in an urban area where there are so many construction activities going on. He is likely to succeed because of his long experience in this business. This loan will increase his monthly turnover by 35 percent as well as his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials for resale

loans.name: Maa Geladei Self Help Group

texts.en: Meera is a 28-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents, husband and her child, who is in school. Her husband is a farmer. For the past two years, Meera has been selling cow's milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Meera is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group Maa Geladei Self Help Group (SHG). There are 10 members in the group and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture and grocery shops. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 120,000 INR . She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. Meera has a dream of providing a better life for her family. All the members of this group cooperate and help each other to enhance their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and pay for renovating a cattle shed.

loans.name: Bori

texts.en: Bori is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as honest, trustworthy, reliable and committed to work. He operates a retail shop where he sells food stuffs and household items. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of water storage facilities and walking long distances to look for water. He will use the KES 39,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will have more branches of retail shops. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous  loans of KES 200,000 and KES 150,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
42 year old Mamie lives in Montserrado County, in the Caldwell area. She is a 11th grade dropout, married, and has two children living at home and attending school. Her first child is 25 and her youngest child is 19.
Mamie is presently operating a food center where she sells soft drinks, beer, rice and soup, and fufu (dough made of cassava). She has been selling from a shop in the local market for ten years now.  She explains that the rainy season is the major challenge she faces in her business. She learned this business from her mother and established this business with money from her mother.  She explains how helpful her business has been in supporting her children over the years with their schooling. She is requesting a loan to buy additional goods and ingredients.
Her plans are to become a big businesswoman and to educate both of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and ingredients

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as strong and determined. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He describes his biggest challenge as lack of enough water. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store enough clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will have his own permanent house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ann Maa Chachikeswari Mahila Samiti Group

texts.en: Laxmi is a 43-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her husband, father-in-law and her only child. Her husband is a farmer. For the past two years, Laxmi has been selling cow's milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Laxmi is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Ann Maa Chachikeswari Mahila Samiti. There are 11 members in the group and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture and running a grocery shop. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 275,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. Laxmi has a dream of providing a better living for her family and wants to see her children be admitted to a good school

loans.use: To purchase a cow and renovate a cattle shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as trustworthy and respectful. She is a teacher in a primary school. She describes her biggest challenge as difficulty in accessing clean water. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water dispenser that will enable her family to access clean water for drinking. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lead weights, floaters, new fishing net and to pay for boat repairs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is a mother of four children aged 3 to 10. Arlene has been a rice farmer for seven years now. Her husband also works in the farm to provide for the family. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She dreams of making her business a success so she can give her family the best in life. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability. Any income generated will provide healthy meals for her children and will keep them in school too.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Novedades Brayan Group

texts.es:
Novedades Brayan es un grupo integrado por familiares, las tres son mujeres muy emprendedoras, cada una ellas tiene su propio negocio: Raquel se dedica a la venta de ropa; Maricela, a la venta de mochilas y zapatos y finalmente Doña Emma, a la venta de ropa. 

Doña Emma dice tener 40 años de edad, está casada con el señor Narciso y juntos formaron una familia con ocho hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende de dicha pareja y aún se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria. Doña Emma está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y a KIVA para comprar más ropa, tela, hilos, estambres entre otras cosas. El negocio de Doña Emma tiene ya 19 años, ella comentó: “Inicié con la venta de ropa yo misma porque nuestros hijos eran muchos y de alguna manera yo necesitaba ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis hijos". Fue así que Emma comenzó a vender artículos de fantasía en las plazas chicas y pueblitos, recuerda que entonces no tenía un local fijo, pero aun así sus ganancias eran buenas. Sin embargo, poco a poco ahorró para poder pagar la renta de un local más estable para no caminar mas entre las calles y fue cuando también decidió vender ropa de todo tipo. En su local tiene ya tres años y su negocio se encuentra en otro municipio. La dificultad de Doña Emma es la renta del mimso local porque el pago mensual es muy caro y no ha podido conseguir otro a mejor precio, cada es debe pagar $4,000 MXN anteriormente pagaba solo la mitad pero poco a poco la renta ha ido aumentando hasta llegar a ese costo. Doña Emma no se desanima ante esta situación, todo lo contrario, ella es muy trabajadora y necesita de sus ganancias para poder seguir pagando esa renta, además de que es mejor tener un local estable de lo contario todos los días tendría que trasladar su mercancía hasta su casa, esto implicaría mucho más trabajo para Doña Emma. “No me gustaría perder este local porque ya es muy difícil conseguir un establecimiento, mi única meta es poder seguir ayudando  a mi hijo con sus estudios, me encantaría verlo con una carrera profesional para que así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida”. Las tres integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas con las instituciones porque con su crédito podrán invertir en su negocio y así podrán ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
"Novedades Brayan" communal bank is made up of family members, three enterprising women. Each one has her own business: Raquel sells clothing, Maricela sells backpacks and shoes and finally Emma sells clothing. 

Emma says she is 40 years old and is married to Narciso. Together they make a family with 8 children although only one of them is still dependent on them, studying in Secondary School. 

Emma is requesting this loan from VisionFund and Kiva to buy more clothes, cloth, thread, yarn etc. She has done this business for 19 years. She comments," I started selling clothing myself as there where so many children. I had to do something to help with the household expenses and the education of my children".  She started selling accessories in the small plazas and villages. She remembers that although she didn't have a fixed place to sell the revenues were good. However little by little she was able to save enough to rent a more stable commercial spot so she didn't have to trudge through the streets. This was when she decided to sell clothing of all sorts.

She has had this place for 3 years. It is located in another municipality. Emma's difficulty is that the rent is very expensive and she has not been able to find another at a better price. She pays 4000 MXN monthly. At first she paid half that, but the rent has increased little by little climbing to that amount. This does not discourage her, just the opposite. She is very hard-working and needs this income to continue paying this rent. It is much better to have the stable location than to carry her merchandise home with her at night, which for Emma would be a lot more work. "I would not want to lose this place as it is difficult to get a place. My only goal is to continue to support my child with his studies. I would love to see him become a professional as he would be able to enjoy a better quality of living". 

The three members of the group are grateful with the institutions for the loan as they can invest in their businesses and be able to offer a higher quality of living to their families.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, cloth, thread, yarn etc.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ann Maa Bilasuni Self Help Group

texts.en: Basanti is a 44-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents, husband and her children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past two years, Basanti has been selling flower plants and cultivating vegetables in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Basanti is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Ann Maa Bilasuni Self Help Group (SHG). There are 10 members in the group and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture, selling milk, and operating grocery shops. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 300,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase small flower plants, seeds and fertilizers. Basanti has a dream of providing a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase small plants, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48 años de edad habita en un municipio de del departamento de Bolívar, con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 22 años. Francisco visitó hace mucho tiempo a Costa Rica como guardabosques voluntarios y cuando regresó llegó lleno de sueños, por eso se capacitó técnicamente en el Servicio Nacional de aprendizaje e inició un negocio de producción y comercialización de miel de abejas.  Empezó con 2 colmenas que ha multiplicado y hoy tiene 24 en pie de cría, que requieren nuevas cajas, para cambiarlas y adquirir materiales, además de un uniforme completo. En el desempeño de este oficio es ayudado por su hijo que ha aprendido todas las técnicas y le agrega valor al negocio. Su meta mas adelante es tener sus registros del Instituto Nacional de Medicamentos y Alimentos “Invima”, todo su equipo de trabajo completo y un punto comercial. Su mayor desafío son las sequias, porque baja la floración y es superada con alimentos complementarios para sus abejas. En la actualidad Francisco está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  nuevas cajas, materiales para la cría de abejas y un uniforme completo. Con ello inicia poco apoco el cumplimiento de sus metas de prosperidad alas cuales le apunta en su día a día.
texts.en:
Francisco is 48 years old and lives in a municipality of the department of Bolívar with his domestic partner and their 3 children, who range in age from 12 to 22 years. Many years ago, Francisco visited Costa Rica and worked as a volunteer forest ranger. Full of dreams when he returned, Francisco sought technical training with the Colombian National Service. He also began a business producing and selling honey. The 2 colonies he began with have since multiplied into the 24 colonies he now has in production. He needs to change the colonies into new changes which means that he will need to acquire materials and a complete beekeeper's uniform.

Francisco receives help from his son in the execution of this business. His son has learned all of the techniques and adds value to the business. Francisco's goals are to: register his products with the National Institute of Medicines and Nourishment ("INVIMA"); add to his production equipment; and open a storefront. Drought is the greatest challenge that his business faces, because fewer flowers bloom. He is able to overcome periods of drought by purchasing additional feed for his bees.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Francisco has applied for through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to purchase new cages, materials for raising the bees and a complete beekeeper's uniform. With this loan Francisco can begin, bit-by-bit, fulfilling the goals of prosperity which he focuses on every day.

loans.use: to purchase new cages, materials for raising bees, and a beekeeper's uniform.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena is 32 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has two children between the ages of 11 months and 4 years old. Only one of her children is in school, and they all live at home. 

For the past eight years, she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. One of her main challenges is the high prices of cosmetics; sometime the consumers are less. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. 

She plans to save money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 17 to 24 years old. She describes herself to be courteous. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of water during dry seasons. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy gutters and iron sheets for her house. This will enable her harvest rain water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have continuous supply of water. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: buy gutters and iron sheets to enable her harvest rain water for domestic use.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 23-year-old married man. He has a child who is two years old. He describes himself to be smart. He operates a farm where he grows crops and does business for extra income. 

He describes his biggest challenge to be lack of water pumps. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy water pumps and pipes to pump water for irrigating his farm. He hopes that in the future, he will earn more money. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy water pumps and pipes for irrigating his farm.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 46-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for five sons and two daughters. For the past years, Khaled has been working in a local company as an employee. He gets a very low wage, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Khaled would like to improve the family living conditions, but he does not have enough money for that.
 
Khaled took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with a hot water using a clean and cheap power. This will improve the family living conditions. 

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water to provide his family with hot water using a clean and cheap power.

loans.name: Maa Grameswari Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2009, 13 women from Darada village stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families and formed a group named Maa Grameswari Self Help Group. The members of Maa Grameswari Self Help Group are all women from a district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs.Basanti, who was selected as their president. The lady standing second from the left side in the back row and wearing a blue-colour saree in the photo is Basanti.

Basanti is 41 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. 

Initially, she started with growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumber, lady finger (okra) and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale. She has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cenorina

texts.en: Cenorina is a Tlaxcalan farmer whose family has been involved in agriculture for generations. Her parents taught her animal husbandry and she has continued to use similar techniques. She isn't against technological innovation, though, and was convinced when she saw a working Sistema Biobolsa biodigester on a farm in a neighboring community. She is now investing in her own, a 10-cubic-meter model, to take better advantage of the abundant manure she currently has on-site while concurrently reducing her energy costs. Her biodigester will process the animal waste into a rich, potent, and essentially free biofertilizer and renewable, methane rich biogas. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a biodigester

loans.name: Ramzeyeh

texts.en:
Ramzeyeh is a 59-year-old married woman from Jenin City. She lives in a small house in the city with her husband and five children: four sons and one daughter. Ramzeyeh's husband is a worker with a very low wage. For the past eight years, Ramzeyeh has had a store for selling herbal creams and medicines. She buys these products from a local factory. It is a profitable project but the costs of these products are very high. 

Ramzeyeh requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to improve her store by adding more shelves and making some decorations to make the store more attractive for the clients. This will increase the store productivity and also her income.

Ramzeyeh appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to improve her store by adding more shelves and decorations

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ramona humilde y trabajadora, a sus 57 años de edad,  labora para una institución del estado como conserje, su esposo es comerciante y los dos se encargan de los gastos del hogar y de pagar la Universidad  y colegiatura  de sus dos hijos. Ramona sueña que en un futuro puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sobretodo poder terminar de construir su casa, en créditos anterior a construido las paredes de su vivienda, en este nuevo financiamiento comprara cerámica, cemento, tubos para cambiar los pilares del corredor  ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y con las lluvias teme que esto se dañe aun mas. Agradece a KIVA Y AFODENIC por confiar en ella a través de estos préstamos.
texts.en: Ramona is a hardworking and unassuming 57 year-old woman.  She works as a janitor for a government institution.  Her husband is a merchant, and the two of them work to pay for the household expenses and for the university and school fees for their 2 children.  Ramona dreams that in the future she will be able to improve her living conditions, most of all, that she'll be able to finish building her house.  With previous loans she built the walls of her house.  With this new loan she'll buy ceramic tiles, cement, and steel tubes to change the abutments of the outdoor covered patio, which has deteriorated, and which she fears the rains will damage even more.  She thanks Kiva and Afodenic for demonstrating their trust in her via these loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Self Help Group

texts.en:
Mani is a 39-year-old lady living with her husband and her child who is 12 years old and in school. Mani's family income is very low, which is why she started her own business two years ago. She cultivates vegetables in her village and she sells them at a nearby market. Mani's husband helps her. He is also a farmer who has good experience in cultivation. Mani formed a group called Maa Saraswati Self Help Group (SHG) with nine women from her village. All the member of this group are engaged in different activities like milk selling, running a grocery shop, bangle selling and vegetable cultivation. 

Mani, along with her group, has requested a loan of 100,000 INR to purchase better quality seeds and fertilizers so she can produce more vegetables to sell. Mani dreams of educating her child and giving a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sri Basudev Self Help Group

texts.en:
Kanaklata is 41 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. Kanaklata is running a small grocery shop that she started two year ago to support her family. Her husband helps her to bring grocery items from the market, as he is a farmer involved in vegetable cultivation.  Both earn 4,000 INR per month, which is very low. That is why she wants to expand her business to earn more money for her children. Kanaklata has formed a self help group called Sri Basudev Self Help Group with eight other ladies from her village. All members of this group are engaged in different kinds of activities like vegetable cultivation, milk selling, flower selling etc., and all are very responsible and loyal towards their businesses.

Kanaklata, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 135,000 INR to purchase more grocery items like sugar, oil, biscuits, rice, etc. She wants to educate her children, give them a better standard of living and save some money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, oil, biscuits, tea, rice etc.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be humble and cautious. She operates a farm where she grows crops for sale and own for consumption. 

She describes her biggest challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy iron sheets and gutters for water harvesting. This will enable her family to have enough water for domestic use. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and gutters for water harvesting.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Sandra de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al elaboración y venta de tortillas  adicionalmente posee una tienda desde hace varios años, es una persona muy amable lo que la ha llevado a ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, además es muy responsable, puntual, con muy buena moral, gracias su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar su familia adelante, Doña Sandra solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales,  cal y mas mercadería para poder surtir su tienda, y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Sandra is 38 years old and lives in her own house alongside her two children.  She makes a living making and selling tortillas and, in addition, has had a shop for a few years.  Sandra is very friendly and she has earned the trust of her customers.  She is also very responsible, punctual, and has good morals.  Thanks to her efforts she has helped her family to get ahead.  Sandra is applying for a loan to buy corn by the hundredweight, lime, and more merchandise in order to stock up her store.  She can then increase her income and improve her and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn by the hundredweight, and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente  vive en con sus padres, él es comerciante vende fruta preparada  y antojitos  tostadas de plátano y yuca, es una persona  muy trabajadora responsable y muy amable  es muy conocido en la zona, por ello tiene mucha clientela con lo gana de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el negocio comprando frutas, limones, chile, salsa negra, plátanos, yucas, papas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo  y generar un mayor ingreso   para incrementar sus ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: This borrower lives with his parents.  He is a businessman and sells ready-to-eat fruit, snacks, and yucca and plantain chips.  This borrower is very hard-working, responsible and friendly.  He is well-known in the area and so has many customers.  What he earns in his work helps cover household costs. This entrepreneur is applying for a loan to buy fruits, lemons, chillis, sauce, plantains, yuccas, potatoes, and more, and to continue with his work.  He will earn more money and increase his profits, and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits, lemons, chillis, sauce, plantains, yuccas, potatoes, and more.

loans.name: Eliphas

texts.en:
Eliphas is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be passionate. He operates a farm where he grows crops for sale and for own consumption. He also does business to earn extra income. He describes his biggest challenge to be lack of pumps and pipes. 

He will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy a water pump for irrigation in his farm. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his economic status and maximize land productivity. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for pumping water for irrigation.

loans.name: Edith María

texts.es: Edith, a sus 63 años de edad es madre de un hijo adolescente de 16 años y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Desde que era muy joven conoce la labor de la modistería, actividad que realiza en la finca donde reside y que alterna con la cría, engorde y comercialización de cerdos, así complementa sus ingresos, mientras que utiliza el espacio que tiene disponible en su finca. Los cerdos son vendidos luego de ser engordados, ya sea vivos o por kilos, dependiendo de los requerimientos que haga el cliente. Con el ánimo de aumentar su capital de trabajo y su producción, solicita el crédito para comprar lechones para engorde, que le permitan tener disponibilidad suficiente para satisfacer la demanda tan alta en la época decembrina que se aproxima, donde se aumentan las ventas de estos animales. Edith desea hacer de su negocio una actividad rentable, donde pueda tener una producción escalonada que le genere ingresos constantes y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en: Edith, at 63 years old, is a mother to her 16-year-old son and she has been the head of the household since she separated with her husband.  Since she was young, Edith has worked as a seamstress.  She works on the farm where she lives and, in addition to this work, also raises, fattens up and sells pigs.  With this she is able to earn more money and utilise the available space on the farm.  Once fattened up, Edith sells the pigs, either alive or by the kilo, depending on the customers' needs.  With the aim of increasing her working capital and her production, Edith is applying for a loan in order to pigs piglets to fatten up. This will give her enough pigs to satisfy the high demand that always comes in December - it is during this month that sales increase.  Edith wants her business to be profitable, and to have staggered production so as to have a constant income.  With this she can improve her living conditions and her loved ones' well-being.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten up.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 40 year old, single woman. She has one child, who is two years old. She describes herself as humble and trustworthy. She operates a clothes store, where she sells second-hand clothes. She says her biggest challenge is a lack of water storage facilities.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water barrel, to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand and diversify her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water barrel, to store clean water for family use

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a 41-year-old married woman, from Gaza city. She lives with her husband and three young sons. Kefah is an employee in the public sector. She is paid a very low income. Two years ago, Kefah decided to open a pharmacy in the city, to help her husband with part of the family expenses. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

Kefah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more medicines, to resell to the local customers. This will raise the pharmacy's productivity and also her income. Kefah appears in the photo, working in her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy more medicines, to resell to the local customers

loans.name: Lilo

texts.en:
Lilo is a 40-year-old married woman with 8 children. She makes and sells donuts, pork buns and pies in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business.

Lilo needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a large basin, a sack of sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, soy sauce, chicken and garlic onions. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Lilo has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a large basin, a sack of sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, soy sauce, onions, chicken and garlic onions.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, yams and ta'amu to earn a living. She has been doing this work for 3 years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy chemicals, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, bushknives, a file and a pickaxe for her plantation.  With her profits, Maria hopes to extend her business.

Maria has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, bushknives, a file and a pickaxe.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 25 years old and a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as trustworthy and humble. She operates a clothing stall, where she sells clothes.

She says her biggest challenge is a lack of water storage facilities. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage tank, to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand and diversify her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage tank, for family use

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 34-year-old married woman with 3 children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Telesia needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, bushknives, chemicals, a rake and a shovel.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Telesia will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, bushknives, chemicals, a rake and a shovel.

loans.name: Sepa

texts.en:
Sepa is a 29 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and ta'amu to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Sepa has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, bushknives, a wheelbarrow, a spade and a pickaxe for her plantation. With her profits, Sepa hopes to extend her business in the future.

Sepa has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, bushknives, a wheelbarrow, a spade and a pickaxe.

loans.name: Alexander De Jesus

texts.es: Alexander de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermana, desde hace varios años posee un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad con que realiza las prendas de vestir y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, Alexander está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de telas, botones, agujas, tijeras, herramientas, etc. para tener equipado su taller  y darle mejor atención a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad  económica.
texts.en:
Alexander, 37, lives in his own home with his mother and sister. For several years, he has had a sewing workshop in his home. He has many customers due to the quality of his clothing and his good prices. With his earnings, he helps with household expenses.

Alexander is requesting a loan to buy fabric, buttons, needles, scissors, tools, and other supplies to stock his workshop and provide better service to his customers. This will help him earn more profit and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, scissors, and more.

loans.name: Jumah

texts.en:
Jumah lives around the airport community. She is 34 years of age and she completed 3rd grade before starting this business. She is married with six children who live at home and attend school. Her children are between 9 and 18 years old.

For the past four years Jumah been selling rice by bag in the local market; she started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from people in the market--at that time she was not selling. She enjoys the business because of the amount of experience she receives every day. Her plans are to purchase more rice by bag to expand her business and to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by bag to expand her business.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a 50 year old  woman who is married with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. 

Malo is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Malo will use the loan for cement, iron roofing and timbers. She will also use part of her loan for chemicals, shovels, a spade, a rake and a wheelbarrow.

Malo joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, cement, iron roofing, timbers, a shovel, a spade, a rake and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, desde hace varios años posee un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad con que realiza las prendas de vestir, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José está solicitando un crédito para la compra telas, botones, agujas, tijeras, herramientas, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 41, lives in his own home with his wife and son. For several years, he has had a workshop in his home. He has many customers due to his good prices and the quality of his clothing. With the money he earns from working, he is able to pay some household expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy fabric, buttons, needles, scissors, tools, and other supplies in order to continue his work, since this is his only source of income. This will help him give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, scissors, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Eder Javier

texts.en: Eder, a veterinarian and hog farmer, is up-to-date with sustainable farming practices. He is investing in a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, to reduce the negative impacts of the animal waste generated on his farm, while benefiting from the energy and biofertilizer produced. The energy, in the form of renewable biogas, will allow him to reduce his liquefied petroleum gas purchases. Concurrently, the treatment process will reduce the odors that now draw complaints from neighbors. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and lives in Villasis Miligan, Mahayag, Molave ZDS. She is married with 4 children.

Evangeline has a sari-sari store that sells canned goods and breads; she earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for additional capital for her store. Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories such as canned goods, breads and other items.

loans.name: Margarita Elizabeth

texts.es: Margarita de 58 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 20 años de edad quien trabaja y ayuda en los gastos del hogar, margarita se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, perfumes, cremas, lociones, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su hija logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña  margarita esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su  negocio ya que esa es la única fuente de ingresos que ella posee y así poder tener junto a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita, 58, is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her 20-year-old daughter, who works and helps with household expenses. Margarita makes a living by selling beauty products, perfumes, creams, lotions, and other products wholesale. Her business is in her home. She has many customers due to her good prices and the quality of the products she sells. With the money she makes from sales and her daughter's help, they are able to pay household expenses.

Margarita is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise to continue with her business since it's her only source of income. Also, it will provide her and her daughter with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, perfumes, creams, lotions, and other products wholesale.

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator for Unidos Para Progresar 3 & 4. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her home is a compound for her three children. She lives with her children and her long-term partner. Maria has successfully completed five years of loans with Esperanza, and this is her ninth loan. She sells shoes, clothes and accessories, from her home and by walking around her community and other communities. 

She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory, to access more customers and sell more products. She will use this loan to buy many pairs of shoes, sandals, sneakers, and other types of shoes, as well as clothes and women's accessories. Maria says she enjoys doing business, and her most important dream is to produce enough income to provide for all of her family's needs. She has been saving her profits since she started her business, almost five-and-a-half years ago, with her first Esperanza loan. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To increase her inventory by buying shoes, clothing, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is a 43-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is industriously caring for her dried fish selling activities. She is married and has 4 children. She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. 

The business is doing well. She has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now, Rubie sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting 10,000 PHP from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional kilos of fish to dry. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of fish to dry

loans.name: Jenerose

texts.en:
Jenerose is 38 years old and lives in Culo Molave ZDS. She is married with 4 children.

Jenerose has a sari-sari store and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, soap and other items.

Jenerose has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Jenerose hopes to improve her business and her lifestyle, so that her children have a good future someday.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, soap and other items.

loans.name: Vida Y Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIDA Y FORTALEZA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Doris es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de material de escritorio, venta de pescado, distribuidor de cerveza, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Doris es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sobres manila; este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, quien realizaba la elaboración de este producto, el que vendía por mayor, posteriormente a tener su pareja decide implementar esta habilidad en el establecimiento de su nuevo negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papel prensado) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “VIDA Y FORTALEZA”  communal bank is in their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana office. It has eight members and is led by a board of directors. Doris is the president. The members' businesses are diverse, amongst them are: the sale of writing material, selling fish, a beer distributor, food sales and a neighborhood store. The loan will benefit all the members.

Doris says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, on the invitation of a friend who is a member. She has a business selling Manila envelopes. She learned the trade from her father who fabricated this product and sold it wholesale. After getting married she decided to include this skill in establishing a new business. 

The loan that Doris is requesting is to increase her working capital (buying pressed paper) that she'll purchase at the wholesale distributors of the city of El Alto. After processing it, she'll sell it in her commercial space. This work allows her to generate revenue to maintain, as well as possible, her household. She lives with her common-law husband and her three children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she enjoyed the health and loan training.

loans.use: to buy pressed paper.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Avelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Avelina is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 26 years old and married with three children.

Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, laundry detergent, noodles, bath soap, cooking oil and other groceries for her general store.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Catherine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, laundry detergent, noodles, bath soap, cooking oil and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Helena Emperatriz

texts.es: Helena de 28 años, es la propietaria de un restaurante donde además vende frituras; su negocio inició por tradición familiar, pues de su madre lo aprendió, por eso Helena aprovechando que habita cerca a la carretera Troncal del Occidente, donde pasan los viajeros y visitantes de un parque muy reconocido, emprendió su propia aventura de negocios y le fue muy bien pues hasta hoy  ellos conforman su principal de mercado de clientes. Helena trabaja con mucho esmero, porque su meta mas importante es terminar sus estudios y mejorar su nivel de vida, ensanchando su negocio. En la actualidad maneja una liquidez no menor del 18%, y requiere capital de trabajo para invertir en un mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, mercancías, licuadoras y frutas, para adicionar jugos de frescas frutas naturales producidas en la zona tropical de Colombia.
texts.en: Helena, 28, is the owner of a restaurant where she also sells fried foods. Her business started through family tradition, since she learned it from her mother. Taking advantage of the fact that she lives near the Troncal del Occidente highway, where travelers and visitors to a well-known park come by, she started her own business and it went well. Today they are her main customers. Helena works painstakingly, because her most important goal is to finish her schooling and improve her quality of life, expanding her business. Currently she has a liquidity that is not below 18% and she needs working capital to invest in a greater volume. This is the reason why she asked for a Kiva loan. This is her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy supplies, merchandise, blenders and fruit, to add juices made from the fresh natural fruits in the tropical zone of Colombia.

loans.use: to buy supplies, merchandise, blenders, and fruit

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a 32 year old woman who lives with her partner and 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, yams, etc. to earn a living. She has requested this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Ruta will use the loan to buy cement, nails, timber and iron roofing. She will also use part of her loan to buy weed-sprayer and chemicals. Ruta joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, timber, and iron roofing, as well as weed-sprayer and chemicals

loans.name: Upu

texts.en: Upu is a 32 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Upu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, barbed wire, a rake, a wheelbarrow, an axe, a shovel and bush-knives for her farming business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Upu hopes to help her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, barbed wire, a rake, a wheelbarrow, an axe, a shovel and bush-knives.

loans.name: Olevia

texts.en: Olevia  is 56 years old and married with 8 children. She runs a small business selling ice cake in her community and has been doing this for many years. Olevia has requested a loan to buy cordial, sugar, foam cups, a deep freezer and Chinese lollies. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Olevia hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cordial, sugar, foam cups, a deep freezer and Chinese lollies.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a private entrepreneur from the city Vanadzor of the Lori region.  She lives with her parents and brother.  Monika runs a small local store, where different household goods are sold.  Her store has contracts with different sport complexes and provides them necessary things.  Monika’s brother supports her very much in running the small business. 

To be able to run the business in a more sustainable way and to become compatible, Monika needs a loan of $3,000.  This will allow her to do lining of the store and to enlarge her assortment of goods.  She has previously received a loan from a local financial institution but was not able to repay it.  However, thanks to the hard work, Monika was able to run her small business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments.  Thus, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.  The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Monika and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their small business.

loans.use: to do lining and to purchase household goods for her store.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 47-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 4 children.  They live in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province.  She sells rice soup while her husband is a motor-taxi driver.  She has been in this business for 11 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day.  With this, she can save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Mao has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has successfully repaid the previous loans.  The loans helped her family to relieve the financial burden and to improve their livelihood.  Now she is requesting another loan from VisionFund.  Mao, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy ingredients for cooking rice soup.  She hopes to earn more income from her current business in order to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for rice soup.

loans.name: Valaauina

texts.en: Valaauina is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling BBQs in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Valaauina has requested a loan to buy BBQ sets, boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, garlic, onions, soy sauce, tomato sauce, foam plates and foil. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Valaauina will look at improving her business and also help her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy BBQ sets, boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, garlic, onions, soy sauce, tomato sauce, foam plates and foil

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a 28 year old single lady with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, curry powder, garlic, onions, cooking oil, foam plates and foil. In the future, Ama hopes to continue her business so she can meet her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, curry powder, garlic, onions, cooking oil, foam plates and foil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 51-year-old single woman who operates a grocery store.  She describes herself as courteous and obedient.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of clean water.  She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy iron sheets, nails, and water gutters to enable her to harvest rainwater.  She hopes to have a water reservoir in the future.  This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails, and water gutters to enable her to harvest rain water.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy operates a green grocery store.  She describes herself to be trustworthy and humble.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of water storage facilities.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.  She hopes that in the future, she will open a big green grocery store.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Genecita

texts.en:
Genecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells clothes in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear items.  Genecita has been in this business for 5 years and she also earns additional income from a general store.

Genecita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to expand her business.  Genecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Chamnan's Group

texts.en:
Chamnan is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and eight children in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia.  All of her eight children, two of whom are dependent, are still in school.  To feed the family, Chamnan and her husband earn a living as farmers.  They raise chickens and ducks and sometimes work for others for a fee.  Having been in this business for almost 20 years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Chamnan has been with VisionFund for one loan, which she completely repaid.  This helped to improve her family’s livelihood and to keep her children in school.  As the leader, her group is applying for another loan with VisionFund.  Chamnan is going to use her portion to buy more chickens and ducks.  She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 57 years old and married with ten children.  She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines.  She has been doing so for 5 years while also earning additional income from motorcycle transportation.

Esmeralda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Gertrudes

texts.en:
Ma. Gertrudes is 50 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Ma. Gertrudes has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.  Ma. Gertrudes aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maa Sidheswari Self Help Group

texts.en:
Bhasi is a 41-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children, ages 14 and 17 years old, who are in school. Bhasi's family income is only 3,000 Indian rupees (INR). That is very low, and that is why she started her own business two years ago. She cultivates vegetables in her village and sells them at a nearby market. Bhasi's husband helps her; he is also a farmer having good experience in cultivation.

Bhasi formed a group that is "Maa Sidheswari Self Help Group" with nine other women from her village. All the member of this group are engaged in different activities, such as selling milk, a grocery shop and vegetable cultivation. Bhasi and her group have requested a loan of 120,000 INR to purchase better quality seeds and fertilizers, so she can produce more vegetables to sell. Bhasi has a dream of making her children educated and giving a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is 45 years old and married with six children, four of whom are dependents still in school.  Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof, located in Battambang province’s Sangke district.  The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice in her village.  She has been running her business for 12 years, earning about KHR 60,000 per day.  She is able to save about KHR 15,000 per day. 

Phan received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, two cycles ago.  She has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and to support her family’s needs.  With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for another loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on plowing land.  She hopes to increase her crop yields, to earn more income to make a living better, and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is a 30-year-old married man with 3 children.  He lives in a village of the Moung Russey district.  Phal and his wife have been farming rice for 10 years.  He manages to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to feed his family and children. 

This is the first loan for Phal with VisionFund.  As the leader, Phal is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.  He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a new house, to increase his pig business, and to keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Mercedes Yaneth

texts.es: Doña mercedes  de  34  de edad  vive con sus padres y su hermano,  ella se dedica a la  costura desde hace varios años  produce blusas, faldas,  y otros tipos de confecciones, posee mucha clientela que la buscan por la calidad con que realiza las prendas de vestir también lo que confecciona sale a venderlo  a los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia,   de esta manera ella logra solventar cada unos de los gastos de casa, doña mercedes solicita crédito   para poder  invertir  en el negocio comprando telas, botones, agujas, etc.  de esta  manera  ella piensa mejorar sus ingresos y  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Doña Mercedes is 34-years old.  She lives with her parents and her brother.  She has made her living sewing for the past few years.  She makes blouses, skirts and other types of creations.  Doña Mercedes has a lot of clients who seek her out for the quality with which she fabricates her clothing.  She also goes to markets near her home to sell her clothing.  Through her business, Doña Mercedes is able to meet each one of her household expenses.  She is requesting the loan in order to invest in her business by purchasing cloth, buttons, needles etc.  In this way, Doña Mercedes plans to improve her income, her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, needles etc.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 40 years old and married with four children. She earns a living fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Mary Jean has been in pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Mary Jean is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Sabjesia

texts.en:
Sabjesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 26,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more stock for her store, including canned goods, candies, soft drinks, cooking oil, dried fish and detergent.

Sabjesia has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income by direct-selling Avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, including canned goods, candies, soft drinks, cooking oil, dried fish and detergent.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a go-getter.
