A villager residing in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Chhean is in her early 60s and strives for a living via rice farming on one hectare of land. This is the business that she has had for ages. 

This is not the first loan for Chhean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have helped her to uplift her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now she is teaming up in a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund.  

As a leader, she will spend this entire loan portion to construct a proper latrine for her family. She hopes that she can improve the sanitation practices in her household so that she can pay attention to her business instead.

loans.use: To construct a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Kheap's Group

texts.en:
Kheap, married, is a rice farmer from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is able to earn about 38,000 KHR per day from farming her two hectares of rice and her husband’s occupation as a paid-worker. Kheap is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans, which she has repaid with success, have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle so it is better than before. 

Now in a group of five, she is a leader. Kheap will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her crop. Additionally, she will spend her loan portion to buy piglets to raise in order to have additional income. She hopes that she can send her kid to school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her crop.

loans.name: Al-Wafaq Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Al-Wafaq”. It is made up of four members who work together in Aden, Yemen. This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. 

Seham is 29 years old, a married woman with one child. She is a merchant; specifically she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. She sells her products from her house. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothes market in her neighborhood. She is very grateful to her neighbors who supported her over all these years.  

At the present time, her business doesn't get her as much profit due to the bad situation in Yemen. So she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. She will sell them to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business.

loans.use: to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts and shoes.

loans.name: Eveling Jannet

texts.es:
EVELING JANNET, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, estudiante  de la carrera de Contabilidad, la cual viene estudiante hace cuatro años. Ella dedica 8 horas al día a sus estudios, sólo le falta un año para terminar de estudiar. Uno de los obstáculos que encontró para continuar con sus estudios fue la solvencia económica, apesar de estudiar en una universidad particular en la cual no se pagan mensualidades, se realizan otros gastos al realizar los trabajos, compra de libros, inscripción en cursos y otros.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la inscripción en un curso de excel avanzado en una universidad de prestigio, asimismo se inscribirá en un curso de ingles ya que es requisito para la obtención de su título al final de su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Eveling Jannet is 22 years old, single, and a student earning a degree in Accounting.  She has been studying for four years.  Eveling dedicates eight hours a day to her studies and is still a year away from completing her degree.  One obstacle that is preventing her from continuing her studies is her financial situation.  Even though she is studying at a private university, she is not able to make her monthly tuition payments since she had other expenses such as buying books, paying her course enrollment fees, and other costs.  

The loan she received will be invested in an advanced Excel course at a prestigious university.  She will also enroll in an English course since it is a prerequisite for obtaining her degree so that she can graduate from the university.

loans.use: to pay for an advanced computer course and an English course.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 44 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en una población muy cerca a la hermosa Cartagena de Indias. Allí se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y también genera ingresos practicando actividades de mejoramiento estético a domicilio. Su primer negocio fue  servicio de embellecimiento, que lo práctica desde hace 20 años, ella hace arreglos capilares, manicure, pedicure etc. Posteriormente aprendió de su esposo la preparación de pizza y trabaja este negocio con él. Su sueño es tener una sala de belleza bien acondicionada y finalmente generar buenos ingresos para apoyar los estudios de calidad de sus hijos. Su mayor desafío lo representan los tiempos de lluvia, pues afecta el nivel de ventas de las comidas rápidas. Judith maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas promedia no menor del 8%. Desde estos indicadores se proyecta el financiamiento que solicita, mediante un credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en harina de trigo por bultos, grasa, queso entre otros insumos y también comprará pintauñas, removedores, para fortalecer su servicio como manicurista.
texts.en:
Judith, 44, lives with her husband and three children in a community very close to beautiful Cartagena de Indias.  She makes and sells fast food.  She also earns income giving beauty treatments at home.

Judith's first business was in the beauty field, which she has been in for 20 years.  She does hair, manicures, pedicures, etc.  Later her husband taught her to make pizza, and she works with him in that business.

Her dream is to have a well-equipped beauty salon and generate a good income to support a quality education for her children.  Her greatest challenge is the rainy season because it affects the level of her fast food sales.

Judith's average sales profitability is no less than 8%, indicators she projects for the Kiva loan she's requesting.  It's her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

She's going to invest in wheat flour in bulk, shortening, cheese, and other ingredients.  She'll also buy nail polish and polish remover to strengthen her service as a manicurist.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for fast food as well as nail polish and polish remover

loans.name: Milly

texts.es: Milly de 24 años de edad, es una joven que habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 1 a 7 años al suroccidente de  la ciudad. Milly es la propietaria de un pequeño almacén que hace año comprara a su madre con el apoyo de su cónyuge. Ella poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer, pues trabaja esmeradamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche en una frecuencia diaria de lunes a domingos. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y referidos, a quienes les vende de contado y a crédito, con buenos precios, pues compra a distribuidores mayoristas en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su meta mas adelante es mudar su local a un sitio más comercial, pues su desafío principal es el incremento de las ventas, para lograr utilidades y poder ahorrar, para cumplir su sueño de tener su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará colonias, cosméticos, papelería, accesorios y paquetes de regalos. Con su inversión aumentará los inventarios y con el ello planea incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades, para poco a poco con su persistencia lograr junto a su cónyuge sus sueños de prosperidad familiar.
texts.en: Milly, 24 years old, is a young woman who lives with her husband and her three children aged 1 to 7 southwest of the city. Milly is the owner of a small store that she bought from her mother a year ago with the support of her husband. Little by little she has made it grow, since she works diligently from 8 in the morning until 7 at night every day of the week. Her main customers are her neighbors, friends, and referrals, to whom she sells in cash and on credit with good prices, since she buys from wholesale distributors in the city of Barranquilla. Her goal for the future is to move her store to a more commercial site, since her main challenge is increasing her sales to make a profit and being able to save in order to realize her dream of having her own house. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy colognes, cosmetics, stationery, accessories, and gift packages. With her investment, her inventory will increase, and with it she plans to increase her sales and her profits in order to achieve her dreams of family prosperity along with her husband, little by little and with persistence.

loans.use: to buy colognes, cosmetics, stationery, accessories, and gift packages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Rutty

texts.es: Rutty tiene 27 años , está casada con Edgar y tiene un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. Rutty se dedica al campo dedicándose al cultivo y venta de cacao orgánico por ser una labor muy rentable de su zona. Heredó su trabajo como agricultora gracias a sus padres con quienes vivió desde muy pequeña y esto le sirvio para aprender las técnicas necesarias que permite la obtención de un producto apto para la venta en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Considera el trabajo de campo como muy abnegado, logrando contar también con la ayuda de trabajadores del lugar para las tareas más complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y recolección de las mazorcas maduras. Para obtener una calidad deseada de su producción suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Rutty is 27 years old. She is married to Edgar and has a son, with whom she lives in her own house. Rutty is a farmer and grows and sells organic cacao, since it is very profitable work in her area. She came into her work as a farmer thanks to her parents, with whom she lived from the time she was very young, and this helped her to learn the necessary techniques that allow her to obtain a product suitable for sale in the distribution centers of her town. She thinks that farm work is very self-sacrificing. She also has the help of area workers for the most complicated tasks like removing weeds and collecting the mature pods. In order to obtain the desired quality from her produce she often fertilizes her plots of land with organic fertilizer. This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels thankful for the financial support she receives to move forward. She also promises to make her loan repayments in a punctual manner. This time she would like 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
PEDRO, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y junto a su pareja trabajan en su carpintería, actividad que realizan desde hace mas de 24 años. Éste actividad le ha permitido mantener a su familia, cubriendo las necesidades principales de sus hijos y brindarles estudios.
Pedro forma parte del grupo "Los Girasoles", formado por 8 socios entre hombres y mujeres. Ingresó a éste grupo para poder obtener prestamos para poder cumplir con pedidos de muebles, por lo que el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de madera, pegamentos, clavos y pintura.
texts.en:
Pedro, 45, has four children. He and his partner work in carpentry, which they have done for 24 years. This work has allowed him to support his family and cover the main necessities for his children and give them an education.

Pedro is part of the Los Girasoles group, which is comprised of eight members—both men and women. He joined this group to get loans to finish his furniture orders. This loan will go toward buying wood, glue, nails, and paint.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture that's been ordered.

loans.name: Om-Tareq Group

texts.en: Om-Tareq is made up of four ladies who applied for a loan of 90,000 YER. They live in Aden, Yemen. Hana is 34 years old, a married woman with 3 children. She began her business by selling perfumes, incense, and clothing door-to-door, and after a period of time she was able to save some of her daily package money. She works hard to provide for her family`s expenses. Hana has applied for a loan to buy perfumes, incense, and clothing to expand her business. She hopes to earn a good income, which will allow her to improve her own and her family's quality of life. She is hoping that, with the extra profit she hopes to earn as a result of the loan, she will be able to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense, and clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Walter Vladimir

texts.es:
Walter de 21 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, es empleado de una empresa que vende teléfonos celulares; vive con su bisabuela y se encarga de cuidarla y darle buena vida para que se mantenga saludable.

Aparte de trabajar para la empresa, Walter también tiene conocimientos de reparación de computadoras a eso se dedica cuando no presta sus servicios como empleado.

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de programas originales de computación y herramientas para reparar celulares y computadoras,

En un futuro Walter quiere tener una empresa propia que repare computadoras, él es una persona que se mantiene actualizada para dar el mejor servicio posible.
texts.en:
Walter, 21 years old, is unmarried and childless. He is employed by a company that sells cellular phones. He lives with his great grandmother and is responsible for taking care of her and seeing to it that she has a good life and stays healthy.

Aside from his work for the company, Walter also knows how to repair computers and that is what he does when he is not working as an employee.

He will use the loan to purchase original computer programs and tools to repair cell phones and computers.

In the future, Walter wants to have his own business repairing computers. He is a person who keeps up to date so that he can provide the best possible service.

loans.use: to buy original computer programs and tools to repair cell phones and computers.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana, a sus 29 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos de 3 y 9 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en su negocio, una fábrica de arepas que comenzó hace aproximadamente 4 meses, la producción que saca la comercializa entre sus vecinos y en diferentes tiendas del sector, para ello contrata a una persona que le colabora. Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, quien se ha dedicado a esta labor durante muchos años. De esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor (maíz y leña) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan por comprar en cantidad, así tendrá disponibilidad de insumos para sacar la producción y cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que le realizan, abriendo la posibilidad de incrementar su clientela y por ende los ingresos. Eliana sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, fortalecerlo y ampliar su clientela para que en un futuro pueda convertirlo en una gran empresa, que sea rentable y le permita ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una excelente educación para sus hijos.
texts.en: Eliana is 29 years old. She is the mother of 2 children, aged 3 and 9. She lives in a common law marriage with her spouse. Right now she works at her business, an arepa factory that she started about 4 months ago. She sells what she produces to her neighbors and different stores in the area. To do this, she employs a person who helps her. She learned this activity from her mother, who has done this for many years. In this way, she has been able to generate enough resources to get her family ahead. Now she is asking for the loan to buy raw materials wholesale (corn and firewood) in order to take advantage of the discounts she gets by buying in large quantities. This way, she will have materials for production to fill the orders she has in a timely manner. This will open up the possibility of increasing her clientele and therefore her income. Eliana dreams of making her business grow, fortifying it and widening her clientele so that in the future she can offer her family a better quality of life and an excellent education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials wholesale (corn and firewood).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de dos hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. Vilma cuenta con un hotel desde hace 3 años. Inicialmente tenía dudas en cuanto a abrir su negocio por eso decidió alquilarlo a terceros pero tras ver que era posible manejar el negocio personalmente decidió tomar las  riendas de su negocio y trabajar para el crecimiento del mismo. A diario debe estar al pendiente incluso en horas de la madrugada para recepcionar a viajeros y demás visitantes que se encuentran en su localidad en busca de alojamiento. A pesar de ello se siente a gusto con su negocio ya que le permite  estar casi siempre con sus hijas. Le agrada realizar mejoras de manera constante a su negocio tales como repintado y renovación constante de Sabanas y otros muebles. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de sabanas, jabones y otros productos para su hotel.
texts.en:
Vilma, 33, is a single mother of two daughters who live with her in her own home. Vilma has had a hotel for three years. Initially, she had doubts about opening her business, which is why she decided to rent to third parties. However, after she saw that it was possible to personally manage the business, she decided to take control of it and work to make it grow. Every day, she has to be on-call, including the early hours of the morning, to check in travelers and other visitors who are in her area looking for accommodations. Despite this, she is happy with the business because it allows her to almost always be with her daughters. 

She likes to constantly make improvements to her business such as repainting and switching out sheets and furniture often. This is Vilma's second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to keep moving forward. She also promises to make her payments punctually. Currently, she is requesting 2,00 nuevo soles to buy sheets, soap, and other products for her hotel.

loans.use: to buy sheets, soap, and other products for her hotel.

loans.name: Al-Ra`ay Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ra`ay and is comprised of four ladies. They applied for a loan of 180,000 Yemeni Rial (YER). Fatehia lives with her family in a poor area in Aden, Yemen. She is 48 years old and a married woman who has six children. She has been selling perfumes and incense for ladies. She is a professional in this field, and her goods are required in the market. She started her business selling food then she was able to improve her business to sell incense and perfumes. 

She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy incense and perfumes. This loan will be  be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.name: Ana Xiomara

texts.es:
Doña Ana Xiomara es una mujer emprendedora luchadora de 30 años de edad, acompañada y de su relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales viven con ella y colaboran con las diferentes actividades como ser: limpieza, corte, abono, figuración, etc. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria incompleto cursado hasta el 4 grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron el cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia desde hace mucho tiempo y generaciones y hoy en día en compañía de su compañero de hogar. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres ubicado a una distancia de su casa de habitación cercana a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.
 
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para poder comprar abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que ayuden a prevenir que sus cultivos se infecten con la roya y otras plagas que deterioran la calidad del producto siendo sus planes a futuro tener una amplia plantación dando variedad de grano a sus clientes y a todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra que hoy en día ella trabaja de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Ana Xiomara is an enterprising woman who is a fighter. She is 30 years old, married and from her relationship has 4 children who live with her and help her with her different activities such as: clearing, cutting, fertilizing and plotting, etc. She has an incomplete primary education and went to school up to 4th grade and couldn't keep going to school due to lack of financial support from her parents. They were the ones who taught her how to grow coffee, an activity her family has done for a long time and for generations. Today she does it with her husband. The land they grow on is their own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents, located nearby her house. She walks there every day.
 
Today she is asking for help to buy fertilizer and other materials to help prevent her crops from being infected with rust and other diseases that deteriorate the quality of the product. Her plans for the future are to have a large plantation with a variety of beans for her customers and everyone who consumes the product. This way, she can generate more income that will help fortify the inheritance for her children and grandchildren so that they can keep working the land se works for generations to come.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Carlita Patricia

texts.es: La señora Carlita Patricia tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo en una casa en anticrético,  tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su principal actividad de la señora Carlita Patricia es la elaboración de diferentes panes, esta actividad lo realiza en el domicilio de su madre. Para incrementar sus ingresos decide solicitar un crédito para la compra de materias primas como harina, azúcar, manteca para la elaboración de PAN y así  tener almacenado para todo el año, ya que constantemente estos insumos suben de precio y con el tiempo quiere  construir su propia casa que tanta falta le hace y de esta manera tener un techo donde vivir y realizar su actividad de una mejor manera.
texts.en: Carlita Patricia is 25 years old. She lives with her husband in the house they are renting. She has 2 minor children. Carlita Patricia's main activity is making different breads. She does this activity in her mother's house. In order to increase her income, she decided to ask for a loan to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, and lard to make bread and thus have enough for the whole year. These items are always going up in price and she wants to build her own house that she wants so badly and in this way have a place to live and do her activity in a better way.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar and lard.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en:
Fortunato is 60 years old and a resident of Ubay, Bohol. He is married with seven grown children.

For 23 years, Fortunato has been in the Sari-sari (convenience) store business. He sells rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and other snack foods. He is asking for a loan to buy stocks in bulk like beer, soft drinks, rice, canned goods, chips and noodles.

Fortunato hopes to live an abundant life in his old age.

loans.use: to buy stocks in bulk like beer, soft drinks, rice, canned goods, chips and noodles.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 51 years old from Ubay, Bohol. She is married with five children, four of whom are grown and the youngest is 18. Gregoria has been in the business of farming rice for seven years now. She is struggling with her need for farm inputs this season. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and to continue her livelihood. 

With her hard work, Gregoria has high hopes for the future. It has been her dream to expand her business and own more land for better profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 44-year-old rice farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He has been farming rice for a long time now to support his eight children, ages 4-22. Joel also transports passengers on his motorcycle to earn additional income.

Joel works hard in his rice farming business. At the moment, as many farmers have experienced, he is struggling to provide for his family while also maintaining his livelihood. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. Joel knows that producing quality crops requires an adequate supply of fertilizer.

Whatever income generated will provide for his family’s daily consumption and his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 39 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with 7 children, ages 1-18.  For 18 years she has been farming rice for a living, together with her husband. They work hard to raise their family together. Luzviminda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.  She dreams of making the most out of her business so she can support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Maravillosas De Tilacoca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLOSAS DE TILACOCA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de carne, tejido de chompas, venta de fruta, costura de polleras, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás ayudando a su madre en el negocio familiar, posteriormente ella decide seguir con el negocio pero de forma independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Maravillosas de Tilacoca” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Community Center.  This group consists of 11 members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Julia serves as the treasurer.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as weaving blankets, selling vegetables, selling meat, knitting sweaters, selling fruit, making skirts, and selling livestock.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Julia.  She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house.  Julia currently has a business of weaving blankets.  She is familiar with this line of work after having learned the trade several years ago by helping her mother with the family business.  Later on, she decided to continue in the same trade but work independently.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool, which she will acquire at the nearby fairs.  Afterwards, she will use this material to make the products that she sells from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to maintain her household.  Julia is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Julia said that she enjoys the training seminars about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Oscar Obdulio

texts.es: Don Oscar de 50 años de vida vive en casa  propia  junto a su  esposa, sus hijos y sobrinos, él se dedica a la venta de pollos  desde hace 7 años  vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes tiendas que se encuentran cerca de su casa ya tiene mucha clientela establecida, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, él solicita un crédito con el cual piensa en  realizar una inversión comprando pollos por mayor  y mejorar la  producción para sus clientes con mas grandes pedidos  y distribuirlo en las tiendas, expandir mas su negocio y de esa manera generar mayores ingresos y alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Oscar is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, his children, and his nephews and nieces.  He has been selling chicken for seven years as a street vendor and at different stores near his home.  Oscar already has a well-established clientele.  He is a hardworking and responsible gentleman.  

Oscar is requesting a loan because he plans to buy more chickens in bulk.  He will be able to satisfy his customers who place large orders and distribute more products to the stores.  As a result he will be able to expand his business, generate more income, and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 51-year-old woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is married to a farmer and has four children aged 11 to 18.
 
Narcisa is also also engaged in farming to help augment the income of their household. Her business started eight years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her profits from farming assures her family of food and her children, their educations.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 57 years old and married with five adult children. She works in the farm with her husband and has been farming rice for a long time now. Victoriana earns an average income of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) out of her business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for labor and buy pesticides in order to maintain her livelihood. Victoriana can hope to have a better harvest once her farm inputs are available. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and profitability so that she can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor and buy pesticides

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 23 years old from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 5. Her husband works as a security guard to provide for them. For a year now, Venus has been operating a Sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells seasoning, biscuits, toiletries, noodles and canned goods. Her store is situated within her home.

Venus is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to replenish her store like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and seasoning.  

In the future, Venus plans to buy products and items that she does not currently carry to increase her overall income and send her children to school. She also dreams of having a big Sari-sari store someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits and seasoning.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year old Necitas lives in Ubay, Bohol, with her husband. She has had a thriving hog-raising business for seven years now. This livelihood helps in bringing in an income of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for their needs. 

Necitas is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplements for her hogs.

She plans to continue investing in hog-raising and make it even bigger to uplift their living conditions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and have a bigger piggery for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old and from Ubay, Bohol. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 5. Her husband works as a mechanic while Susan has been farming rice for a year now. Susan works hard in order to provide for her children. But sometimes she is struggling to make it. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her crops.  She dreams of making the most out of her business so she can give her children a better future through education. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for three years, and she also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 35 years old and from Ubay, Bohol. He is married with four children. His eldest is 14 and the youngest is 7. For a year now, Rodrigo has been in the business of selling purified water in his neighborhood. This business provides safe water to drink for the residents. He accepts delivery by order. He finds this to be a good business. He is asking for a loan to pay for water, gasoline and a spare tire for his motorcycle during delivery. His income provides food for his family and pays for his children’s education.

Rodrigo hopes that, in the coming years, he will be able to continually support his children’s schooling until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay for water, gasoline and a spare tire.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is married and residing at Taguitik, Lanao del Norte, along with her family. Her husband sells nipa in town, while she buys nipa leaves and produces nipa for sale. She has been doing this for more than six years to earn a living. 
 
She has borrowed PHP 10,000 to buy more nipa leaves to weave. They sell their weaved nipa in town and mostly in bulk, taken from their home where they manufacture it. She is hopeful that through this business, the general living situation of their family will be improve.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves to weave

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia es una mujer soltera de 25 años, no tiene hijos pero posee una vivienda hecha de adobe que le cedieron sus padres. Creció en el campo desde muy niña y aprendió el oficio de la agricultura actualmente posee un terreno agrícola con plantaciones de café y cacao los cuales son su principal sustento económico y que cultiva con mucha dedicación ya que es uno de los productos que le permite obtener buenos ingresos.
Cuando se inicio en esta labor consideró que no era algo sencillo pero podía así seguir la tradición familiar y obtener ingresos con la actividad que mas le gusta hacer. Suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico ya que el café es un producto muy representativo en su región por la calidad que suele obtener gracias a los factores  climáticos. Tiene la suerte de contar con diversos compradores a lo largo y ancho de su zona que remuneran el trabajo de los agricultores como ella de manera justa. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 25 years old and single.  She has no children but she is the owner of her adobe house, which she was given by her parents.  Yesenia grew up in the country and learned to work as a farmer.  She now has a plot of land where she grows coffee and cacao.  These crops are her main source of income and she is dedicated in her work as these are products that allow her to earn a good income.

When Yesenia started this work, she did not think it was easy but she wasa able to follow family tradition and earn an income from the job that she likes most.  Yesenia usually fertilises her land with organic manure as coffee from this region is known for its high quality that results from the climate.  Yesenia is lucky to be able to count on various buyers from across the region who pay coffee growers a fair price.  This is Yesenia's first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the support she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She promises to make her payments on time.  On this occasion Yesenia is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy breads, curls, eggs and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, a sus 32 años de edad vive con su esposo e hija de años. Es profesional de Negocios Internacionales, pero por gusto, convicción y tradición familiar se dedica a elaborar manualidades para comercializar, ofrece artículos de arte country, accesorios de bisutería, cuadros decorativos, adornos navideños entre otros, productos que vende por encargo, adicionalmente también vende productos por catálogo como ropa y calzado, con lo que complementa sus ingresos para apoyar a su esposo solventando algunas necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy intuitiva, organizada, con buen gusto y dinamismo; se esfuerza para sacar adelante todos sus proyectos en los cuales ha ido involucrando poco a poco a su hija, enseñándole todas las manualidades con las que trabaja. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, el dinero será invertido en la compra de materiales y mercancía (telas, hilos, pinturas, figuras en madera, piedras para accesorios, vestuario y calzado en general) con el fin de aprovechar las ofertas y los descuentos que obtiene, así tendrá disponible todo los insumos necesarios para cumplir con la entrega de los  pedidos de manera oportuna, ya que se aproxima la temporada navideña y sus ventas se incrementan notablemente, generando mejores ingresos. El principal desafío que posee es tener su microempresa organizada pues debido a la diversidad de artículos que ofrece es difícil establecer un plan de trabajo, sin embargo ha sabido aplicar sus conocimientos y ha cumplido con los requerimientos que hacen sus clientes. Nancy sueña con fortalecer su microempresa, dándole un verdadero manejo empresarial e incluso desea luchar para tener la oportunidad de ejercer su profesión buscando la opción para exportar sus productos; pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar con empeño, disciplina y dedicación; solo así logrará mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y prosperará con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old and lives with her husband and daughter.  Nancy has a degree in international commerce but, through choice and in order to continue family tradition, she works producing handicrafts to sell.  She sells country art items, jewellery, decorative frames, Christmas decorations, and other items.  She takes orders from customers for products, and, in addition, she sells catalogue items such as clothes and footwear.  This complements her husband's income and supports him in covering basic household costs.  Nancy is very intuitive, organised, has good taste, and is dynamic.  She puts in the effort so that all her projects more forward.  Little by little she is also involving her daughter in the business and teaching her daughter about craftwork. Nancy is applying for this loan in order to increase her working capital.  She will invest the money in buying materials and merchandise (threads, material, paint, wooden figurines, stones for accessories, clothes, and footwear) in order to to take advantage of the offers and discounts that she can enjoy.  With this she will have all the necessary supplies in order to fulfill her orders quickly.  The Christmas season is approaching and her sales will 
noticeably increase and generate a higher income.  Nancy's biggest challenge is to organise her business as, due to the variety of products she offers, it is difficult to have a working plan.  However, she has been able to use her knowledge and has managed to meet her customers' needs.  Nancy dreams of strengthening her business and managing it more professionally.  She even wants to have the opportunity to export her products, though she realises that she must be determined, disciplined and dedicated in order to achieve this.  Only with these three things will Nancy improve her family's quality of life and prosper with her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and merchandise (threads, material, paint, wooden figurines, stones for accessories, clothes, and footwear)

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: El joven Pedro se dedica a cultivar granos básicos como frijoles y maíz, ademas de hortalizas,poco a poco ha ido aumentando su producción cada año. Pedro toda su vida a vivido en la comunidad del tuma en esta comunidad no hay energía eléctrica es por eso que desea un crédito  para adquirir un sistema solar pequeño que le permita poder tener luz  su hogar ya que actualmente por la noches se alumbran con candelas o candiles , lo que causa el humo  daño a la salud de su familia.
texts.en: Pedro makes a living growing basic grains such as beans and corn.  He also grows vegetables and every year, little by little, he is increasing his production.  Pedro has lived in the Tuma community all his life.  Here there is no electricity and so he is applying for a loan in order to buy a small solar power system that will give him electricity in his home.  Currently, at night, he uses candles and oil lamps to light up the house.  This is causing smoke damage and affecting his family's health.

loans.use: to buy a small solar power system in order to have electricity in the house.

loans.name: El Progreso 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Bianca is one of the members of the group El Progreso 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5, made up of 25 micro-business owners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. This is Bianca's second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step towards business growth.

She has had her business selling underwear for around four years. She started the business with her own resources. Bianca is planning to invest her new loan towards purchasing underwear at wholesale. She is going to use her earnings to continue saving and increasing her inventory. She is dreaming of having an improved business in order to provide her children a better and safer life. She is a single mother with three children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children alone. She loves to watch television and to be with her children.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Undrakh

texts.en:
Mr. Undrakh, 30 years old, lives with his mother, wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began running an auto repair shop three months ago, and before this he rendered taxi service to local people. His wife has a position of manager at a private firm and his mother is a data entry worker at an intelligence authority in Mongolia. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay his brother's tuition fees. His brother studies in Japan and needs to pay his tuition. He thinks investment in education is the best thing he can do for his younger brother.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Josefa is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 (Christ is the Hope). She lives with her long-term partner and their four children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in La Romana. The community is a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers where she, her family, and the other 14 female micro-entrepreneurs in this group reside. 

Josefa says that her most important goals are to have her own house in the main city and to raise, educate, and support her children. She operates a fruit and vegetable stall, from which she sells goods her customers use to make their daily food. Normally she sells to her neighbors. She plans to use her portion of this loan to invest in her business by buying goods to resell, including vegetables, fruits, meats, and charcoal.

Josefa is excited to receive her sixth loan from Esperanza, as each previous loan helped her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for December sales. Josefa thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, meats, and other foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with three children. They live in Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, planting rice to earn a living. She helps him manage their farm. She borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC because the farm needs fertilizer. She always finds ways to improve their farm, and the profit will be used to improve their living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 60 years old. She is married and has been blessed with four adult children, two of whom are unmarried and help her in the business of selling vegetables and fish in a market in Ponhea Lueu district, Kandal province. Together they can earn a net profit of US $12 per day. Her husband can’t afford to help her anymore due to the limitations of his old age. Meas has been a market vendor for almost 10 years. She aims to become financially stable so she wants to expand her business and ensure high sales. 

Due to financial constraints, she has applied for a loan in the amount of US $1,500 in order to buy a motorcycle, which will be used to transport vegetables from her suppliers to the marketplace. She believes that this loan will enable her to make her business goals achievable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting vegetables to the marketplace.

loans.name: Norce

texts.en:
Norce is a 45-year-old widow. She has 5 children: Elisa, 25, in college; Albert, 22, a worker; Yacob, 22, in college; Fransisca, 18, just recently in college; and the last one is Yacomina, 15, just recently in Senior High School. 

Since the death of her husband in 2002, Norce has struggled to raise her children alone in the best way she could, and was also slightly supported by her late husband's pension. A few years ago she tried to establish a kiosk business. Unfortunately, due to lack of capital and competition, her kiosk went bankrupt. 

Currently, she leased the building of her kiosk to someone else, because she has been frequently ill. The need for her 3 children's education costs has led her to apply for a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent for the children's education fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's education fees.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 50 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns additional income from raising pigs and coconut wine vending. Adelaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Berginia

texts.en:
Berginia is 41 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. She has been farming bananas for 3 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.

Now Lorna is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jonahlee

texts.en: Jonahlee is studying for her Bachelor of Science degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Her mother is a government employee while her father operates a retail business to make a living. Their family income is good enough to meet their basic needs. As the fourth child, Jonahlee needs to work hard and be patient because her family's educational support must be divided. She is requesting a loan to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester of her degree program. She is hopeful that she will finish her studies and help provide for her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Aydalina es una mujer microempresaria de 40 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es un taller de zapatería desde hace 6 años, tiene 7 trabajadores independientes que se encargan de elaborar el calzado. Tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales como hilos, suelas, forros, etc.
texts.en: Aydalina is a micro entrepreneur who is 40 years old.  She is married and has 2 children at home.  For the past 6 years she has had a business making shoes.  She has 7 independent contractors who make shoes.  She has been a client of the bank for 4 years.  She needs this loan to purchase materials such as thread, soles, linings, etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as thread, soles, and linings.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 45, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. Her partner is Eduardo. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosita operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php,25,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund to buy recyclable materials from collectors.
 
Rosita dreams of having a better living and hopes that her business will flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Doña rosa de 45 años de edad, vive en casa  propia junto  a su familia  posee un taller  de costura desde hace 15 años, actualmente  trabaja con escolares, adicional a eso  vende pupusas, es una mujer que se esfuerza para poder lograr llevar el sustento a casa y es así como  ella logra solventar algunas de sus necesidades; ella está solicitando un crédito para realizar la compra de tela, botones, agujas, hilos, etc.  para poder seguir confeccionando  y así generar más ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She has a sewing workshop that she has managed for 15 years.  Rosa currently works with school children, but she also sells “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings).  

Rosa is a woman who strives to sustain her household and also provide for some of her family’s necessities.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric, buttons, needles, thread, and other items so that she can continue sewing.  This will enable her to generate more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evangeline has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Evangeline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Estefania

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 19 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Chincha. Carmen es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se encuentra estudiando en la universidad la carrera de ingeniería veterinaria, asimismo para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza; ella atiende alrededor de 10 clientes en el día, en especial los fines de semana; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y dedicada.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá solventar los gastos de la matricula de la universidad y también comprar productos de belleza para su pequeño negocio, de esta manera podrá seguir estudiando y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”  Terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Carmen is 19 years old and lives in the city of Chincha.  She is a young woman who has a great deal of drive to succeed.  For this reason, she tries hard and devotes herself to her university studies in which she is pursuing a degree in Veterinary Studies.  At the same time, she is able to pay for her educational expenses since she started a small business in which she sells beauty products.  Carmen attends to approximately 10 customers a day, especially on the weekends.  She believes she is able to move forward because she is responsible and dedicated.  

Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to pay for her tuition expenses at the university and also buy beauty products for her small business.  This will enable her to continue studying and improving her income.  Carmen continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of finishing her degree and becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition expenses and to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Yolinda

texts.es:
Yolinda tiene 34 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de madera. Yolinda se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de 2 hectáreas que compro junto a su pareja hace más de 15 años y se convirtió desde entonces en su principal sustento económico y también principal oficio. Trabaja todos los días de manera independiente realizando actividades de mantenimiento  a sus plantaciones de cacao y café para obtener a fin de campaña una producción de calidad  que vende a los acopiadores del lugar logrando recuperar el dinero que suele invertir durante la campaña productiva. Tiene la suerte de tener terrenos muy fértiles que le permiten obtener buenos resultados, no obstante suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico.
Tiene la costumbre de contratar a trabajadores del lugar para que le apoyen en la cosecha y el deshierbo de sus plantaciones. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo según comenta es recolectar las mazorcas de cacao ya que posteriormente solo queda extraer las almendras y secarlos para su venta final. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de almácigo.
texts.en:
Yolinda is 34 years old.  She is divorced and has 4 children who live with her in a home made of wood. Yolinda works in agriculture on her 2 hectare plot that she purchased with her partner over 15 years ago.  It has become her main source of income and her primary job.  She works for herself and every day can be found caring for her  cacao and coffee plants so that at the end of the season she will have a quality crop that she can sell to the local wholesalers and recoup he money that she has invested during the growing season.  She is fortunate to have very fertile land that allows her to obtain good results, however she still needs to fertilize her land with organic fertilizer. 

She generally hires local workers to help her with harvesting and weeding the crops.  What she likes most about her work is picking the cocoa pods, after which she just has to extract the beans and dry them for final sale.  This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is thankful for the financial support she will receive in order to keep going.  She promises to make her payments on time.  She is requesting 3,0000 new soles for the purchase of organic fertilizer and seedling plants.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedling plants.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 46, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Arturo who works in the business and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilibeth operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php- 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells charcoal and processed foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lilibeth dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia  junto a su esposo, su hija y su madre, ella se dedica la elaboración de diferentes tipos de atoles desde hace 6 años, esto lo realiza en un parque que se encuentra cerca de su casa,  es muy trabajadora y  con muchas ganas de salir adelante,  por ello solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en capital de trabajo y poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios como: leche, elotes, harina de maíz, azúcar, maicenas de sabores, etc. y de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in her own home with her husband, her daughter, and her mother.  She has been making different types of “atoles” (warm beverages made from cornmeal) for six years.  She conducts her business at a park near her house.  The borrower is a very hard worker who has plenty of drive to succeed.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will invest as operating capital for buying necessary ingredients such as milk, corn, cornmeal, flavored cornstarch, and other ingredients.  

This will allow her to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk, corn, cornmeal, flavored cornstarch, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza  4, 5 & 6 (Christ is the hope). She is a young mother with three children. She lives with them and her long-term partner in a simple structure, located in a rural community in the city of La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers. 

Margarita says that her most important challenge is to have her own house and to raise her children with a safe home and support all their needs. She operates a fruits and vegetables stall, a place where she sells goods to make daily income for food. This is a small stall in front of her house selling the most favored vegetables like plantains, cassava, potatoes, and veggies for salad. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy more vegetables and fruits.

Margarita is excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza, each one helping her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Margarita thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as pineapples, papayas, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Doña Cristina es una mujer adulta de 58 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchas Fuerzas de salir cada día que pasa adelante junto y sus 5 hijos adultos cada uno en hogar. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleto ya en su juventud no pudo seguir estudiando con los pocos ingresos económicos que percibían sus padres y las circunstancias difíciles por lo que solo curso hasta el 3 grado. En compañía de su esposo se dedican al cultivo y siembra de café siendo este rubro por generaciones el medio de ingreso económico que ha dado alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas aunque con muchas restricciones. Sus hijos todos viven fuera de su comunidad por lo que solo ellos dos se involucran en las diferentes actividades a realizar en el campo como abono, limpieza, fertilización y en ocasiones por su edad contratan personas para la época de corte y recolección del grano para su venta posterior.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y abono ya que de esta forma ella podrá asegurar su cosecha y brindar un producto limpio y sano a sus clientes, de esta manera ella podrá cumplir sus metas lograr mantener sus cultivos sanos y limpios para que puedan ser cotizados en el mercado por su calidad e higiene y mantener su clientela para algún día poder ampliar sus cultivos y dejarlos como herencia a sus hijos y ellos a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 58 years old and married.  She is hardworking and entrepreneurial, and possesses great strength to get ahead each day.  She has 5 adult children all in their own homes.  She attended elementary school but did not complete it.  She was not able to continue her education as a child due to her parents' scarce earnings and difficult situation, so she only attended through the 3rd grade.  Along with her husband she plants and grows coffee, which for generations has been the source of income that has provided food, clothing, and medicine, though with many restrictions. Her children all live in other communities which is why only she and her husband are involved in the different activities in the field such as applying manure, weeding, and fertilizing. Sometimes, due to their age, they hire people when it is time to cut and pick the coffee beans for sale.

Today Cristina is requesting help to purchase fertilizers and manure so that she can ensure a good crop and deliver a clean and healthy product to her customers.  In this way she can meet her goals of having healthy and clean plants so they can command a high price in the market for their quality and hygiene.  She will also keep her customers so that she can one day expand her crops and leave them as an inheritance to her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products to care for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.en:
Jesuita is the group coordinator for Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 4. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic. Jesuita lives with her long-term partner and her four children in a simple home in the rural village of Hato Mayor, where the cacao harvest is one of the main economic activities. 

Jesuita is an excellent Esperanza client and has successfully repaid fourteen loans. With this loan, her fifteenth, she plans to buy fruit and cacao, which she sells in her community and to chocolate producers. Using the proceeds from her business, she has been able to provide for her family and make changes to her home structure. Her dream for the future is to continue to educate her children and make improvements to her house. Jesuita thanks you for your support in helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: To buy fruit and cacao to resell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 45 años, está casada con Juan Carlos de 41 años y vive junto a sus dos hijos en su casa propia construida a base de madera. Desde hace 15 años lidera su negocio consistente en la venta de repuestos para diversos vehículos mayores y menores. Se inició por iniciativa de su esposo quien se dedicó desde muy joven al servicio de la reparación de vehículos. Es administradora de la tienda donde venden diversos repuestos y accesorios usados para   los trabajos que realiza logrando así ser una esposa muy dinámica en cuando al trabajo que desempeñan. Se caracteriza por tener un negocio muy concurrido ya que es muy honrada en cuanto a los precios que posee su mercadería. Como todo negocio comercial es necesario invertir en mercadería que permita surtir el negocio y atraer clientes es por ello que motivada por su trabajo desea abastecer su negocio.
Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos menores al por menor tales como aceites, pernos; entre otros.
texts.en: Zenaida is 45 years old.  She is marred to Juan Carlos who is 41.  They live together with their two children in a home they own which is built of wood.  For the past 15 years she has had a business selling replacement parts for various vehicles.  She started the business at the prompting of her husband who from a very young age had worked as a mechanic.  She manages the store where they sell various used parts and accessories for the work they do and thus is a very dynamic wife in their business.  The business is very busy and she is very honorable in regards to the prices for her merchandise.  As with any business it is necessary to invest in merchandise so that it is well stocked and attracts customers. For this reason she would like to stock her store.  This is her second loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead.  She promises to make her payments on time.  For this loan she is requesting 3,000 new soles to purchase small parts at retail such as oils, bolts, etc.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts such as oil, bolts, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn Lissette

texts.es: Marlyn habita en un barrio con alto índice delincuencial, es madre de tres hijos siendo el menor de 1 mes de nacido, sus prioridades y necesidades aumentan más ahora que sus hijos van creciendo cada día, sus ingresos de la actividad comercial variada que realiza de ropa y cosméticos a veces es buena y otras malas. Marlyn solicita el crédito porque desea invertir en calzados, cosméticos, ropa de niño y adulto para ofrecer variedades a sus clientes, de esta manera espera que mejoren las ventas e irse preparando poco a poco para mantener  surtido su negocio para aprovechar las ventas de diciembre que ya está próximo.
texts.en:
Marlyn lives in a neighborhood with a high crime rate. She is the mother of 3 children, the youngest is just one month old. Her priorities and necessities change as her children grow. The income from her business of selling clothes and cosmetics varies. Some days are good, others are lacking.

Marlyn is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in footwear, cosmetics and clothing for children and adults to offer more variety to her clients. She hopes to increase her sales and prepare little by little to stay well-stocked so as to take advantage of the December sales which are not far off.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cosmetics and clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
This is Agripina, 59, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. They are managing their household as they operate the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income to their family.

Agripina operates an Internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business.

Agripina hopes that her business will grow bigger and have more computers. She dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carmencita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Carmencita is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Cirila has been in this business for ten years. Cirila earns more income from food vending.

Cirila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Antonia lives in Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. Antonia and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. Most of them sell clothes and miscellaneous products. This group is named Fuerza Divina 4 (Divine strength).

Antonia runs a miscellaneous products sales business. She will invest this loan to buy cosmetics, shoes, accessories and other products to sell. She has had her business for almost eight years, starting when she received her first Esperanza loan. She says that her favorite thing is to work on her business. She wants to see her children become professionals.

This is Antonia´s 15th loan with Esperanza International, after she successfully repaid her previous loans, each of which gave her one more step toward improving her business and her life. She said that she has been able to finish building her house, which was one of her most difficult challenges. Now her home is in the building process, thanks to these loans, her savings and profits from her business.  Antonia and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products to sell.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia , aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresa, pone siempre su mayor empeño por poder sobresalir y ser la mejor en lo que hace. Quiere poder aplicar todo lo que conoce en alguna importante empresa. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y esforzándose por llegar a su meta.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a very responsible person who is devoted to her studies and her family.  She aspires to be a professional, and to continue to study and serve other people.

She is studying for a degree in business administration.  She always gives her best efforts so that she can succeed and be the best in what she does.  She wants to apply everything she knows in some important company.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her school tuition, because in this way she will be able to continue to study and work hard so that she can reach her goal.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie is 39 years old and married with three children.

Rizalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rizalie aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa, aged 55, is married and blessed with one child. She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost thirteen years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 3,000. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase bags of rice, canned goods, beverages, and bread to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and earn more profits on her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, canned goods, beverages, and bread to sell

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion, 47, is married and lives in Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. From her desire to help the family, she has engaged in dried fish vending for several years, starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. Now she is planning to borrow PHP 12,000 from Paglaum MP Cooperative. She  wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Anabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Anabelle is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Anabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive con sus dos hijas en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Sus hijas están estudiando. 
La señora Ana tiene muchos años de dedicarse al comercio comenzó vendiendo ropa, perfumería y cosméticos luego decidió vender productos Avon por catalogo y prendas de vestir que ella misma elabora, actualmente vende también calzado y piñatas. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende de forma ambulante también. Ha fortalecido su negocio con la inversión de las ganancias y prestamos. 
Ella ha  solicitado 6 créditos con ODEF, con el actual que es por 11,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas, ropa y compra de cosméticos para la venta. Tiene como meta seguir trabajando para mejorar su vivienda.
