texts.en: Ana is 53 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her two daughters in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida.  Her daughters are in school.  Ana has worked as a salesperson for many years.  She started selling clothes, perfume, and cosmetics.  Then she decided to sell Avon products by catalog and clothes that she made.  She now also sells shoes and piñatas.  She has her business in her home and she sells door to door as well.  She has strengthened he business by reinvesting her earnings and by loans.  She has requested 6 loans from ODEF.  The current loan is for 11,000 Lempiras which she will use to purchase materials to make piñatas, and clothes and cosmetics for sale.  Her goal is to continue working to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make piñatas, rope, and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products, cosmetics, women's accessory, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but also in her household. Aside from her tailoring business where she makes dresses, she sells mineral water for additional income. Her tailoring business has been running for twenty years now, and she has three workers. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their family's everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy tailoring materials such as different types of fabric, needles, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sonia dreams to be more successful in business and have more workers. She hopes to have her dress shop renovated. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials, such as different types of fabric, needles, thread and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
To overcome the hardships of life, Bun, who is 50, aimed to improve her farming business by increasing her yields. This would increase her income in order to provide her children a better quality of life. She has been farming for more than 30 years, planting and harvesting rice and cassava on her farm in the Kampong Thom province with the full support from her helpful husband.
 
Bun wanted to expand her plantation to increase her crop products, but due to insufficient capital she has requested a loan of KHR 1,000,000 in order to pay the labor cost incurred in weeding her cassava plantation. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will make an improvement in their business and increase their yields this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost incurred in weeding her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Ms. Naranchimeg is bachelor degree student who studies IT and mathematics at a private university. When she graduates, a job is ready for her in her hometown as a IT and Mathematics teacher. This shows that how smart and hardworking she is. She will study for two more years.

Tthis loan helps her to pay for her tuition fee as well as dormitory fee. If she does not get the loan, she will pay for tuition fee from student stipends and finding a place to stay will become a big problem for her.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Carolina Antonia

texts.es: Doña Carolina, actualmente habita en la Comarca llamada San Antonio Sur, junto a sus hijos, ella se desempeña como Docente en un colegio publico y con sus ingresos apoya para la educación de sus hijos y gastos del hogar, su espos labora para una empresa privada. Solicita este crédito porque tiene la necesidad de cambiar el techo de sus vivienda ya que esta bastante deteriorado y teme que con esta lluvias sufra mayores daños comprara Perlines, Zinc, pintura anticoresiva. De esta manera ella y su familia podrán vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Carolina currently lives in the region known as San Antonio Sur, together with her children. She works as a teacher in a public school and she uses her income to help pay for her children's education and living expenses. Her husband works for a private company. She is requesting this loan because she needs to change their house's roof, given that it is quite deteriorated and she fears that rain will damage it even more. She will buy structural braces, zinc and anti-corrosive pain. This way, she and her family will be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase Zinc

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel tiene como una meta desarrollar una empresa propia dentro de la ciudad,  ya que el esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y le gustaría poder aplicar todo lo que estudio en su propio negocio.
El es una persona muy visionaria, que quiere progresar en la vida, y sabe que la único forma poder hacerlo es por medio del estudio y sacrificio, es por eso que pide de este crédito, ya que quiere usarlo para pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y así seguir esforzándose por mejorar y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Ariel's goal is to develop his own company in the city, because he is studying for a degree in business administration, and he would like to apply everything that he has studied in his own business.

Ariel is a very visionary person who wants to make progress in life.  He knows that the only way that he'll be able to do this is through study and sacrifice.  This is why he is requesting this loan.  He plans to use the loan to pay for his university tuition so that he can continue to strive to improve and accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, gracias al esfuerzo que están haciendo ya están en su ciclo número doce del programa de comités, ellas están ayudándose para poder salir adelante e ir mejorando.
La Sra. Angelica es la presidenta de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de bebida y carga para teléfonos celulares, también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella está haciendo para poder salir adelante y poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia. La Sra. Angelica solicita de este crédito para la compra de Bebidas en general lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia con ello.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario is the group formed in the city of Luque.  Thanks to the effort they are making, they are in their 12th cycle with the committees program.  They are helping each other to be able to get ahead and to be improving.

Angelica is the president of this group.  She sells drinks and cell phone charges.  The work she is doing to be able to get ahead and to be able to improve her family’s life needs to be emphasized.

Angelica is requesting this loan to buy drinks.  This will help her to firm up her business plan.  It will help her to improve the income with which she will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 38 years old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Alona has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 43 years old and married with five children.

Analie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analie has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 55-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide for her family. She has been facing a lot of problems due to the large family; she has also been facing rainy days due to the low income of her husband. 

Her son has been successfully running a small general store in his community for the last year. He offers various goods for daily use. He has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 
Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

As she wants to grow the business of her son, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the wholesalers at lower rates. He then would be able to meet the increasing demands consistently. 

She is in her seventh loan cycle, and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She has already been investing the amount of her last loan in the same business. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and increase her business capital.

She says thanks to Kiva and to it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sacks of flour, pulses, and various inventories for her general store,

loans.name: Anarela

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Anarela to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola, beer, cigarettes and biscuits. 

Anarela has been involving herself in business activities since 2001. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Anarela independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business

loans.use: to buy noodles, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola, beer, cigarettes and biscuits.

loans.name: Lhagvadash

texts.en: Mr. Lhavgadash is a bachelor degree student who is studies business administration at a public university. He is a passionate and hardworking student and it makes himself well known in his university. However, his family income is quite low and he cannot pay his tuition fees. During the interview he mentioned that there is no alternative to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat is a responsible mother who aims to uplift her family's standard of living by farming rice and cassava for sale in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She is 34 years old and has four children. Having been in the business for almost 20 years, she has enough experience to work out her plan. She wants to expand her cassava plantation, and thereby increase her income to satisfy her family's needs and educate her children.

She has requested a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy farm supplies needed for her cassava crops such as fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. She believes that through this loan she will be able to maintain her crops and ensure a high production this coming harvest season. She hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies needed for her cassava crops

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 42 years old and is married. She has shared that, in terms of housekeeping jobs, this is just an easy task for her to perform because she has been into it when she was single, having experienced working as a house helper. Nieves knows the hardship of life; that’s why she and her husband work hard to give their children a better way of living. 

Nieves has been running her general store business for 15 years. She is wishing for good health to continue to operate the business while she is still able to manage it for her child’s future. 

Nieves wishes for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy spices, seasonings, shampoo, conditioner and soap. Her goal is to expand the business further to increase her income, which will be used for the improvement of their house and living standard.

loans.use: to buy spices, seasonings, shampoo, conditioner and soap.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This time, for her eighth loan cycle with Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), Francisca is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos. She intends to use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers. 

Francisca's pig raising and charcoal retailing businesses were previously funded through NWTF, Kiva's partner. NWTF continues to provide for Francisca and her family with increased income and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell, including rice and sugar.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is 53 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Haydee has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 9,500 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more personal products to sell.

Haydee has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Jobelyn

texts.en:
Jobelyn is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jobelyn is 27 years old and her children are in school.

Jobelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jobelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jobelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jobelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from coffee shop. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is requested by Natalia to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, eggs, oil, coffee, sugar, salt, oil, and slippers. She generates a good income by selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in the store. Natalia lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, eggs, oil, coffee, sugar, and salt for sale in her store

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio es un hombre de 27 años de edad, veterinario de profesión y actualmente se dedica a comercializar ganado, actividad que aprendió cuando trabajó en una subasta. El cliente se caracteriza por ser activo, inteligente y emprendedor, trabaja todos los días con la motivación de lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida para ofrecer a su familia. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más ganado, así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo y tendrá más posibilidad de seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de sus sueños, especialmente lograr hacer de su finca una gran fuente de ingresos, que sea productiva, en cultivos y ganado, para que le permitan tener una estabilidad económica favorable en un futuro cercano y dar a su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 27, is a veterinarian and currently makes a living selling cattle, a skill he learned when he worked at an auction. Mauricio is active, intelligent, and enterprising. He works every day, being motivated by giving his family a better quality of life.

He is requesting this loan to buy more cattle. This will increase his working capital and give him more possibilities to keep advancing toward completing his dreams. He especially wants to turn his ranch into a large source of income that will be productive in farming and cattle. This will allow him to have economic stability in the near future and give his family a more comfortable well-being.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is 50 years old and is a single mother of three children. She is a hardworking and responsible woman who is dedicated to her rice farming business in Kampong Thom province. Having been in this business for years, she aims to expand her rice plantation and increase her yields in each harvest by purchasing an extra piece of land for farming.

Due to a lack of funds, she has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to add to her existing savings of KHR 1,000,000 to buy a plot of land that is 60A in size. Thought this expansion as a result of the loan, she hopes to have abundant harvest and generate a higher income to fulfill her basic living needs.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está en el 15º ciclo  del programa de comité, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas han visto una gran oportunidad de crecimiento y por eso decidieron unirse y trabajar juntas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aurora, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas dulces y saladas y  el crédito lo solicita para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las comidas ya que tiene muy buena demanda y sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos. Comenta que en su última encuesta se encontraba dentro de la línea de la pobreza, pero se esforzó y de esa forma pudo ir mejorando y creciendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras group is in its 15th cycle with the committee program.  All of them are friends and neighbors in the city of Encarnación.  They have seen a great opportunity for growth, and that is why they decided to unite and work together.  They are taking the elimination of poverty survey in order to know about each of their situations.

Aurora is one of the members.  She sells sweet and savory food.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy supplies to make the food.  She has a very good demand, and her customers always place orders with her.  She says that in the last survey she was within the poverty line.  However, she put forth great effort, and this way she was able to improve and grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as women's shoes, men shoes and kids shoes. She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy women's shoes, men's shoes and kids' shoes

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina raises and fattens hogs for sale. She has been in line with this kind of business for three years. Darlina is 44,married, and blessed with four children. Two of her children still go to school.

Darlina plans to buy hog feed and vitamins of her hogs so she could ensure their proper growth. To make her goal realistic, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan so she can let her two children finish their studies and give them a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and viatmins of her hogs

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani, 43, is a responsible mother and is living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her third loan with BRAC; she is a long-time member, and she borrows according to the needs of her family.

Rani belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to meet household expenses with poor earnings. In fact, her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and other scrap goods. He uses a manual four-wheel cart and calls to the people loudly in the streets, asking who is willing to sell scrap goods. 

It is very difficult for him to announce loudly to attract people to him on the streets. He wants to buy a speaker and a tape to repeat his announcement.

Therefore, Rani is requesting a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a speaker and a tape. With these products, Rani hopes that her husband will feel relaxed and drive his cart smoothly in the streets. 

Rani is very impressed with this honorable support. She says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a speaker and a tape for her husband to use to announce his presence on the street and advance his scrap business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married and has four children. She sells dried fish, beans and grocery items. At 57, Rosalina still has the eagerness to develop the business to gain higher income. In this connection, Rosalina is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy cold drinks, eggs, noodles, seasonings and more. 

Rosalina wishes to maintain her good health and continue managing the business well for her family's welfare. She hopes to increase her income to sustain her three children's needs in school and finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks, eggs, noodles, seasonings and more.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a kind 51-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons and four daughters.

She is very hardworking and loves her family very much. Her husband is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in selling timbers and planks to furniture manufacturers. He started this business over 30 years ago. Today, he has many regular customers and takes orders from other cities.

This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for selling in order to expand his business.
 
This is why Khursheed came to BRAC Pakistan as she wishes to obtain a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy inventory for her husband’s shop, such as timbers and planks. 

Her husband hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as his family.
She says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy timber and planks for resale.

loans.name: Khairiya

texts.en:
Khairiya is a 62-year-old married mother of three children who has been working as a tailor for twenty years. To help her beloved husband in making their living and covering their children's expenses, Khairiya also sells shoes and home products to make sure that her family will have several sources of income.

She is acquiring her fourth loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools for her business and to give her son his wedding gift.
She hopes to stay in good health to make sure that she'll stay capable of supporting her husband in covering their family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for her business, and to give her son his wedding gift

loans.name: Nicelly

texts.es:
Nicelly es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una mujer que quiere sobresalir y ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que está estudiando y se está esforzando por poder sobresalir.
Está estudiando la carrera de ciencias de la Educación, y comenta que su meta es poder ayudar a las demás personas que al igual que ella quieren aprender. También quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, y es por eso que quiere estudiar, ya que sabe que es la única forma de crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que se acerca el momento de hacer sus gestiones para poder recibir su titulo y son muy caras. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: Nicelly is from the city of Pilar. She is a woman who wants to stand out and be someone in life. This is why she is studying, and she is striving to excel. She is studying a career in Education science, and she points out that her goal is to be able to help other people like her who want to learn. She also wants to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. It is for this reason that she wants to study, because she knows that is the only way to grow. She is applying for this loan in order to cover her qualification costs, since it will soon be time to make arrangements in order to receive her qualification, and they are very expensive. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for qualification costs

loans.name: Mila Rose

texts.en:
Mila Rose is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials and general store businesses. Mila Rose is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy kitchen-wares and ingredients for her food business.

Mila Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy kitchen-wares and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 35 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as oil, cigarettes, soft drinks (Fanta, Sprite, Coca Cola), Sagiko, beer, coffee, sugar, salt, and water . She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.
 
Filomena lives in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people (including students) come to shop.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store

loans.name: Camilo De Jesús

texts.es: Camilo, a sus 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos adolescentes. Nació y creció en el campo, allí trabajó durante muchos años en una finca encargado de diversas labores agropecuarias, pero, debido a los problemas de orden público que se presentaban decidió radicarse en la zona urbana junto a su familia. Allí comenzó a trabajar como empleado en una cafetería y poco tiempo después se independizó y montó su propio negocio, ubicado en un sector muy transitado, pues queda en una vía troncal a la costa, allí trabaja de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm de Lunes a Domingo y cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado indirecto. Su empuje, empeño y dedicación lo han llevado a lograr sus metas, ha sobrepasado situaciones difíciles y aún debe enfrentar algunos desafíos, como estar ubicado en una zona vulnerable donde se presentan paros de camioneros, lo que afecta directamente sus ventas. Sin embargo, esto no lo desanima, sigue buscando opciones que le permitan seguir adelante, por lo que se anima a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de sillas, mesas y surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, café, alimentos fritos, entre otros) así tendrá la posibilidad de ofrecer más productos a su clientela y satisfacer los gustos para así incrementar sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos que recibe de ellas. De esta forma, Camilo desea seguir avanzando y cumplir sus sueños, especialmente el de terminar de pagar su negocio, pues aún debe una parte del dinero, y en un futuro espera poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y permitir que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de realizar estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Camilo is 47 and lives with his wife and three teenaged children. He was born and raised in the country and worked many years on a farm, responsible for a wide range of agricultural tasks. 

Concerns about safety prompted Camilo to move to the city with his family. He then began to work in a cafeteria, and soon took the initiative to start his own business. Camilo runs a cafe in a very busy neighborhood, on a street leading to a beach. He works seven days a week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. and has one employee. 

Camilo's drive, determination, and dedication have helped him achieve his goals. He's survived tough times and still faces various obstacles, such as truck driver strikes, that directly affect his sales. But Camilo doesn't let such challenges hold him back, and keeps looking for opportunities to improve his business. He is therefore applying for a loan so he can invest in chairs, tables, and wholesale inventory  (snacks, sodas, coffee, fried foods, and other goods). 

These investments will allow Camilo to offer his customers a greater variety of goods to satisfy their tastes, increasing his sales and thus his income. Camilo hopes this will allow him to progress toward fulfilling his ambitions, especially paying off his business, for which he still owes money. Camilo hopes to provide his family a better quality of life and give his children the chance to study at a university.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, and wholesale inventory items (snacks, sodas, coffee, fried foods, and other goods)

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es una persona que quiere salir adelante, comenta que estudio la carrera de Literatura en Lengua Española para ser una profesional que le sirva a la sociedad y también poder superarse más en la vida.
Ella es soltera trabaja en la docencia,  y con este título ella tiene el objetivo de obtener un mejor cargo en el área a que se está desenvolviendo y este crédito será de gran ayuda para lograr mi objetivo. Ella quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas a aprender así como ella lo pudo lograr.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de la facultad, y así cubrir siempre cualquier inconveniente que surja.
texts.en: Liz is a person who wants to get ahead in life. She points out that she studied a degree in Spanish Literature in order to be a professional that serves society, and also to be able to excel. She is single and works in teaching. With this qualification she aims to achieve a better position in the field she is pursuing, and this loan will be of great help towards achieving this goal. She wants to be able to help other people learn as well, as far as she can manage. She is requesting this loan to pay for university fees, and to cover any other issues that may arise.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
El Señor Víctor Manuel, es dueño de una tenería artesanal desde hace 38 años, inicia sus labores desde la 6 am  a 5 pm el proceso de curtiembre de cuero el cual lo realiza manualmente, hace  este tipo de trabajo para llevar el sustento a su familia.  

 Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de cuero para su proceso. 

El señor Víctor Manuel  está agradecido porque sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que compra más barato sus productos de contado  y no de crédito y así ha  mejorado sus condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Víctor Manuel has owned a traditional tannery for 38 years. The business provides for his family and he works in his shop from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. tanning leather by hand. 

The funds from this loan are for the purchase of leather for processing. Víctor Manuel is grateful for the loans he's received from Ceprodel. These loans have increased his working capital and allowed him to purchase more goods at lower prices, paying cash instead of buying on credit. Ceprodel loans have thus improved Victor Manuel's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase leather

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Richel is 33 years old and her children are in school.

Richel has a general store business in the Philippines. Richel requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items such as canned goods, sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

Richel has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Richel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Susana has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling fish.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.
